killers.Name: Luis Garavito
killers.Notes: Child-murderer, torture-killer, and rapist known as ”La Bestia” (“The Beast"). Confessed to killing 140 children over a 5-year period in Colombia. He is suspected of murdering over 300 victims, mostly street children.[2][3]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Pedro López
killers.Notes: Child-murderer and rapist, known as "The Monster of the Andes". Targeted young girls, between the ages of 8 and 12. Arrested in 1980 and convicted in 1983 of killing 110 young girls but confessed to killing 300, exact total unknown. Despite being one of the most prolific serial killers of the 20th century, he was released in 1998. Current whereabouts unknown.[4]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Daniel Camargo
killers.Notes: Child-murderer, believed to have possibly raped and killed over 150 victims, primarily young virgin girls. Confessed to killing 72 victims, and incarcerated with Pedro Alonso Lopez. Considered to be intelligent, and believed to have been motivated to kill from his stepmother abusing him as a child. He strangled young girls in Colombia and was arrested, but he escaped from prison and he started killing in Ecuador; rearrested in 1989, he was killed in jail.[5]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Pedro Rodrigues Filho
killers.Notes: Convicted and sentenced to 128 years, but the maximum one can serve in Brazil is 30 years. He has claimed to have killed over 100 victims, 47 of them inmates. He also killed his father and ate a piece of his heart. He killed his first two victims at the age of 14; he was first arrested in 1973.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Kampatimar Shankariya
killers.Notes: Sentenced to death for the hammer murders of at least 70 people. Hanged on May 16, 1979.[6]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Yang Xinhai
killers.Notes: Would enter victims' homes at night and kill everyone with axes, meat cleavers, hammers, and shovels. Executed in February 2004. Known as the "Monster Killer".[7]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Abul Djabar
killers.Notes: Killed 65 men and boys by strangling them with turbans while raping them. Suspected of over 300 murders. Sentenced to death and hanged on October 21, 1970.[8]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Andrei Chikatilo
killers.Notes: Known as The Butcher of Rostov, The Red Ripper or The Rostov Ripper. Convicted of the murder of 53 women and children between 1978 and 1990. Executed in 1994. One man was previously convicted and executed for his first murder.[9]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Anatoly Onoprienko
killers.Notes: Known as "The Beast of Ukraine", "The Terminator" and "Citizen O". Convicted of the murders of 9 people in 1989 and 43 people in 1995–1996. Sentenced to death, later commuted to life. Traveled through Europe illegally from 1990 to 1995; whether he killed during this time is unknown.[9]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Gary Ridgway
killers.Notes: Truck painter who confessed to killing 71 women. The United States' most prolific serial killer; also known as The Green River Killer. He almost exclusively targeted sex workers from Seattle. Suspected of killing over 90 victims, confessed to 71, convicted of 49.[10]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Alexander Pichushkin
killers.Notes: Known as the Chessboard Killer. Convicted of murdering 48 victims and suspected of killing 60. Claimed to have murdered 62 people, because he didn't know that two of his victims had survived; stated goal of becoming Russia's most prolific serial killer.[11]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Wang Qiang
killers.Notes: Killed 45 and raped ten from 1995 to 2003.[12]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Ahmad Suradji
killers.Notes: Convicted of strangling at least 42 women and girls in a series of ritual slayings he believed would give him magical powers. Executed by firing squad on 11 July 2008.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Thiago Gomes da Rocha
killers.Notes: Brazilian security guard who confessed to the murders of 39 people.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Moses Sithole
killers.Notes: Preyed on unemployed women, posing as a businessman and luring his victims with the prospects of a job, before leading them to an isolated place, where he raped, tortured, and murdered them. Sentenced to 2410 years imprisonment with a non-parole period of 930 years. Known as South Africa's Ted Bundy.[13]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Serhiy Tkach
killers.Notes: A former Ukrainian police criminal investigator, suffocated girls aged between 8 and 18 and performed sexual acts on their bodies after they were dead. Claims to have killed 100.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Gennady Mikhasevich
killers.Notes: Strangled females. Besides killing, he robbed his victims of money and valuable items (that he would sometimes give to his wife as a gift).[14]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Hadj Mohammed Mesfewi
killers.Notes: Responsible for the murders of at least 36 women; executed by immurement in 1906.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Ted Bundy
killers.Notes: American serial killer known for his charisma and good looks. Bundy officially confessed to 30 homicides, but has confessed to killing 35–36 women in the past, and some estimates run upwards of 100 or more. Infamous for escaping from prison twice and murdering multiple victims in one day; sometimes abducting women from the same location within hours of one another.[15] He was executed in the electric chair in 1989.[16][17]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: John Wayne Gacy
killers.Notes: Known to have murdered a minimum of 33 teenage boys and young men between 1972 and 1978, 26 of whom he buried in the crawl space of his Chicago home. Gacy was known as the "Killer Clown" due to the fact he often entertained children at social events dressed in a self devised clown costume. Gacy was executed in 1994.[18]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Ali Asghar Borujerdi
killers.Notes: Known as "Asghar the Murderer". Killed 33 young adults in Iraq and Iran. Executed on June 26, 1934.[19]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Vasili Komaroff
killers.Notes: Known as "The Wolf of Moscow"; horse trader who killed 33 men. Executed on June 18, 1923.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Ramadan Abdel Rehim Mansour
killers.Notes: Gang leader known as al-Tourbini ("The Express Train"). Raped and tortured homeless children, mostly boys aged 10 to 14 years old, aboard the trains between Cairo, Alexandria, Qalyoubeya and Beni Sueif. The victims were usually thrown off the moving train when they were dead or in agony; other times they were thrown into the Nile or buried alive.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Karl Denke
killers.Notes: Cannibal mainly targeting travelers, probably striking them with an axe.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: David Thabo Simelane
killers.Notes: Convicted of 28 murders; 45 bodies were found in shallow graves in the woods outside of Manzini. Sentenced to hang on April 1, 2011.[20]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Dean Corll
killers.Notes: Corll was responsible for the Houston Mass Murders and was murdered by accomplice Elmer Wayne Henley when Corll turned on him. Corll is responsible for the torture and murder of young boys in Pasadena, Tx and elsewhere in southeast Texas.[21][22]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Maoupa Cedric Maake
killers.Notes: Known as the "Wemmer Pan Killer" and "Hammer Killer". He killed his victims with different instruments such as guns, rocks, a knife, and a hammer. Authorities attributed the murders to two serial killers because of the inconsistent modus operandi. In some cases he killed his victims with a rock, in others he shot them, and in others he murdered tailors with a hammer. Maake was arrested after Moses Sithole was found guilty of 38 killings and sentenced to 1,340 years in prison.[23]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Juan Vallejo Corona
killers.Notes: Corona was convicted of murdering ranch laborers and burying them in orchards. He was sentenced to 25 terms of life imprisonment.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Wayne Williams
killers.Notes: Believed to have perpetrated the Atlanta murders of 1979–1981. After being convicted of two murders and sentenced to life imprisonment, authorities closed 22 other unsolved murders, declaring Williams to have been the perpetrator. Williams has maintained his innocence and the case was reopened as recently as 2005.[24]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Fritz Haarmann
killers.Notes: Also known as the Butcher of Hannover and the Vampire of Hannover, because of his preferred method of killing by biting through his victim's throat, sometimes while sodomizing them. He would then dump the bodies in the nearby river Leine. Is believed to have been responsible for the murder of 27 boys and young men. He was convicted, found guilty of 24 murders and executed.[25]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Béla Kiss
killers.Notes: Evaded arrest and conviction after the discovery of 24 bodies hidden in large metal drums in his property in 1916. At that time he was serving in the Austro-Hungarian Army, and deserted when the military was notified of the murders by civilian authorities. His final whereabouts and fate are unknown, as is his final victim count.[26]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Ronald Dominique
killers.Notes: Louisianan serial killer, known locally as the Bayou Strangler and murdered victims in the Terrebonne Parish, Lafourche Parish, Iberville Parish and Jefferson Parish.[27]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Mikhail Popkov
killers.Notes: Former policeman who was convicted of murdering at least 22 women and sentenced to life in prison in January 2015.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Earle Nelson
killers.Notes: Necrophiliac who targeted and strangled landladies throughout the West Coast during 1926; he was hanged in January 1928; also known as "Gorilla Killer" or "the Dark Strangler".
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Manuel Octavio Bermúdez
killers.Notes: Colombian pedophile and serial killer. Known as "El Monstruo de los Cañaduzales" (The Monster of the Cane Fields). He confessed to killing 21 children in remote areas of Colombia.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Patrick Kearney
killers.Notes: Would pick up young male hitch-hikers or young men from gay bars near Redondo Beach, California, and kill them.[28]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: William Bonin
killers.Notes: Bonin and three accomplices are known to have murdered a minimum of 21 youths aged between 12 and 19 in and around Los Angeles. As the majority of his victims were discarded alongside various southern California freeways, Bonin became known as the Freeway Killer. Bonin was convicted of 14 of the freeway murders and was executed in 1996.[29]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Vasile Tcaciuc
killers.Notes: Romanian man who lured victims and then murdered them with an axe; he was arrested after a dog found a dead body in his house on 7 September 1935. He confessed to have committed at least 26 murders. He was shot dead by a policeman while trying to escape from prison.[30]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Yoo Young-chul
killers.Notes: Used a hammer to murder mostly older victims, until his focus shifted to the decapitation and mutilation of escorts after being dumped by a girlfriend who worked in that profession.[31]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Abdullah Shah
killers.Notes: Killed travelers on the road from Kabul to Jalalabad serving under Zardad Khan. Also killed his wife. Executed on April 20, 2004.[32]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Mohan Kumar
killers.Notes: Lured female victims with promises of marriage and gave them cyanide, claiming they were contraceptive pills, Sentenced to death in 2013.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Bulelani Mabhayi
killers.Notes: Known as the "Monster of Thuleni"; killed 20 women and children from 2007 to 2012. Sentenced to 25 life sentences on September 3, 2013.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Alexander Spesivtsev
killers.Notes: Cannibal known as "The Novokuznetsk Monster"; admitted to 19 murders, but 82 bloody sets of clothes were found in his home, along with jewels and photographs of possibly unidentified victims. Found insane and interned in a mental hospital. His mother was sentenced to 16 years in prison for luring Spesivtsev's victims to their home.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Larry Eyler
killers.Notes: Known as "The Interstate Killer"; sentenced to death for the 1984 murder and dismemberment of 15-year-old Daniel Bridges. He confessed to other homicides of young men and boys in five separate states. Died of AIDS complications in 1994.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Sergei Ryakhovsky
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: M. Jaishankar
killers.Notes: Accused of killing at least 19 women. Escaped from jail twice.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Yavuz Yapıcıoğlu
killers.Notes: Killed in various cities of Turkey. 18 murders proven and accused of more than 40 by eyewitnesses and relatives.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Paul John Knowles
killers.Notes: Killed 18 people in various states in 1974. Claimed 35 murders. Known as the "Casanova Killer"; shot dead by FBI agents.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Thierry Paulin
killers.Notes: Known as "The monster of Montmartre". Killed and robbed old women. Died of AIDS before trial in prison on April 16, 1989.[34]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Randall Woodfield
killers.Notes: Known as "The I-5 Killer" and "The I-5 Bandit"; Sentenced to life. Drafted by the Green Bay Packers in the 1974 NFL Draft as a wide receiver but did not make the final roster. Suspected of as many as 44 murders.[35]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Umesh Reddy
killers.Notes: Confessed to 18 rapes and murders. Sentenced to death.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Christopher Mhlengwa Zikode
killers.Notes: Known as "Donnybrook Serial Killer" murdered 18 people in Donnybrook KwaZulu Natal from 1994–1995.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Huang Yong
killers.Notes: Lured and murdered 17 teenage boys, although he is suspected of 25 murders between September 2001 and 2003.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Pedro Pablo Nakada Ludeña
killers.Notes: Known as "El Apóstol de la Muerte" ("The Apostle of Death"). convicted of 17 murders and claimed 25. Sentenced to 35 years in prison.[36]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Donato Bilancia
killers.Notes: Burglar who murdered 17 people, mainly prostitutes, between 1997 and 1998, during six months. Known as the "Prostitutes Killer" and the "Liguria Monster". Sentenced to life.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Irina Gaidamachuk
killers.Notes: Known as "Satan in a skirt". Killed 17 elderly women between 2002 and 2010. Sentenced to 20 years in prison.[37]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Randy Steven Kraft
killers.Notes: Convicted on 16 counts of murder but left a cryptic list of 65 murders. May have had an accomplice.[38]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Mohammed Bijeh
killers.Notes: Raped and killed at least 16 boys and teenagers. Nicknamed the "Tehran Desert Vampire". Was convicted and executed after being lashed in front of a crowd in 2005.[39]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Michel Fourniret
killers.Notes: Known as the Ogre or Beast of Ardennes. He was caught after a failed kidnapping in 2003.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Sipho Agmatir Thwala
killers.Notes: Nicknamed the Phoenix Strangler after the area in which he committed his crimes; he raped and strangled 19 females; arrested, he was found guilty of 16 murders.[40]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Jeffrey Dahmer
killers.Notes: Dahmer ate some of his victims and kept their body parts in his freezer. Was sentenced to life imprisonment; murdered in prison in 1994.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Elias Xitavhudzi
killers.Notes: Nicknamed Panga man for his use of a machete (locally known as a "panga"). He stabbed and robbed his victims between 1953 and 1959; arrested, he was hanged on 14 November 1960.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Jimmy Maketta
killers.Notes: Pleaded guilty to and convicted of 16 murders and 19 rapes committed over a nine-month period in 2005.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Jack Mogale
killers.Notes: Raped and strangled females in the Donnybrook area. Convicted of 16 murders and 19 rapes, nine kidnappings, robbery and assault.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Robert Lee Yates
killers.Notes: Killed prostitutes in the "Skid Row" area of E. Sprague Avenue in Spokane, Washington.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Pietro Pacciani
killers.Notes: Known as The Monster of Florence. Was convicted of the murders in 1994, but the decision was controversially overturned in appeal. However this last decision was overturned by the Supreme Court which ordered a re-trial. This couldn't be held as Pacciani died in 1998. Two of his alleged accomplices were also convicted.[41]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Carroll Cole
killers.Notes: Killed 16 people in California, Nevada, Texas.[42]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Charles Ray Hatcher
killers.Notes: A habitual criminal, confessed to the rape and murder of over 20 young and adolescent males. Escaped from prison several times and was declared a "manipulative institutionalized sociopath" [43]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Jose Antonio Rodriguez Vega
killers.Notes: Nicknamed El Mataviejas (The Old Lady Killer), he raped and killed at least 16 elderly women, ranging in age from 61 to 93 years old, in and around Santander, Cantabria.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Saeed Hanaei
killers.Notes: Confessed to luring 16 prostitutes to his home and killing them in an attempt to "cleanse" the city of Mashhad. His actions were dubbed "The Spider Murders". Hanged in 2002.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Vladimir Mirgorod
killers.Notes: Sentenced to life imprisonment in 2012 for strangling 15 women and one teenage boy to death.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Atlanta Ripper
killers.Notes: Mystery murderer(s) of fifteen Atlanta women in 1911. May have had as many 21 victims.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Robert Hansen
killers.Notes: Prostitutes he kidnapped were released into the Alaskan wilderness for him to hunt down like animals. Based on discovered remains, police suspect him of six murders in addition to the 15 for which he was convicted.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Ángel Maturino Reséndiz
killers.Notes: Known as the "Railroad Killer" because his killings were committed near the railroad tracks he used to traverse the country. He was charged with and/or confessed to 15 murders occurring from 1986 to 1999 in Texas, Florida, Illinois, Georgia, and Kentucky. He was also suspected in a 1997 California murder case and claimed two additional killings he refused to elaborate on.[44]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Dennis Nilsen
killers.Notes: Picked up young men in London between 1978 and 1982 and dismembered them, keeping various body parts around his home.[46]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Elifasi Msomi
killers.Notes: Killed his victims with an axe or a knife in the 1950s; hanged in 1956.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Chester Turner
killers.Notes: Convicted of killing 15 people in Los Angeles, California in the 1980s and 1990s. Sentenced to death.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Bai Baoshan
killers.Notes: Sentenced to 13 years in prison in 1983 for a murder he committed during a failed robbery. Later killed 14 people from 1996 to 1997. Executed on May 6, 1998.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: NA

killers.Name: Carl "Coral" Watts
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Believed to have killed over 80 women in multiple states, in 1982 Watts accepted a plea bargain in Texas in which he would plead guilty to a lesser charge and be granted immunity from murder charges in exchange for providing information on his victims; as a result he confessed to 12 murders and was sentenced to 60 years in prison on the lesser charge. He was sentenced to life imprisonment in separate trials in Michigan in 2004 and 2007, and died of cancer a week after the 2007 sentence was handed down.[47]

killers.Name: Zdzisław Marchwicki
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 14 women in 1964–1970 in Poland's region of Upper Silesia. Zdzisław Marchwicki (executed in 1977) was most likely the man responsible for the killings; however, his guilt remains in dispute. Also known as Vampire of Silesia.

killers.Name: Joachim Kroll
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Ruhr Cannibal" and "The Duisburg Man-Eater"; died in prison in 1991.

killers.Name: Arthur Shawcross
killers.Miscellaneous.information: After being arrested in 1972 for the rape and murder of two children, he was able to plead down to a sentence for manslaughter. After 14½ years of incarceration, he began targeting prostitutes. Strangled and battered his victims. Known as the "Genesee River Killer", "Genesee River Strangler", "Rochester Strangler", and "Monster of the Rivers".

killers.Name: The Doodler
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sketched then stabbed to death 14 gay men in San Francisco.

killers.Name: Marcelo Costa de Andrade
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as The Vampire of Niterói. Raped and killed 14 children in Rio de Janeiro and Niterói. Drank the blood of his victims.

killers.Name: Julio Pérez Silva
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as The Psychopath from Alto Hospicio; killed 14 women. Sentenced to life imprisonment on February 26, 2004.

killers.Name: Hua Ruizhou
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 14 female prostitutes. Executed by a single gunshot to the head on January 31, 2002.

killers.Name: Amir Qayyum
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The brick killer". Killed 14 homeless men with rocks or bricks when they were asleep. Sentenced to death in May 2006.

killers.Name: Jake Bird
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sentenced to death for the murders of two people; confessed to 44 other murders; eleven were substantiated and he suspected in the rest.[48]

killers.Name: Belle Gunness
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Norwegian-born murder-for-profit killer who murdered her suitors and relatives in Indiana. High possibility of over 40 murders. Could have faked her own death on the fire that destroyed her home in 1908; her children had died of strychnine poisoning before the fire, and the woman's body found next to them was decapitated and, reportedly, smaller than Gunness' own.

killers.Name: Cleveland Torso Murderer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Unidentified serial killer, also known as "The Mad Butcher of Kingsbury Run", who targeted drifters and derelicts, of whom only two were identified, between 1934 and 1938 in Cleveland, Ohio.

killers.Name: Kaspars Petrovs
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to strangling 38 elderly residents of Riga, Latvia, in 2003. Convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment for the robbery and murder of 13.

killers.Name: Richard Ramirez
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 13 people between June 28, 1984, and August 24, 1985, in Los Angeles. Known as the "Night Stalker".[49][50] Ramirez was sentenced to death in 1989, and died of natural causes in 2013 while still on death row.

killers.Name: Peter Sutcliffe
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sutcliffe killed 13 women between October 30, 1975, and November 17, 1980. Most victims were killed by a combination of bludgeoning and stabbing, and all but two were killed in the county of Yorkshire. Owing to the modus operandi and location of the murders, Sutcliffe became known as the "Yorkshire Ripper".[51]

killers.Name: Francisco Antonio Laureana
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped and murdered at least 13 women. Was killed in a shootout with police.

killers.Name: Herbert Mullin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Despite detailed confessions, prosecutors decided not to try him for the first three crimes, instead focusing on crimes that conflicted with his insanity plea.

killers.Name: Boston Strangler
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Although Albert DeSalvo was widely thought to be the Boston Strangler, police and others analysing the case have long doubted the truth of his confession.[52]

killers.Name: Lorenzo Gilyard
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Kansas City Strangler". Killed up to 13 prostitutes in the Kansas City area from 1977 to 1993. Sentenced to life on April 14, 2007.

killers.Name: Vasiliy Kulik
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the Irkutsk Monster.[53]

killers.Name: Johannes Mashiane
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Beast of Atteridgeville" 13 counts of murder, 12 counts of sodomy from 1982–1989.

killers.Name: Li Wenxian
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Guangzhou Ripper". Killed 13 female prostitutes in Guangzhou. Executed.

killers.Name: Thozamile Taki
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Sugar cane serial killer".

killers.Name: Rainbow Maniac
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Shot gay men in the head (except one, who was bludgeoned) in the Paturis Park of Carapicuiba.

killers.Name: Donald Henry Gaskins
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Meanest Man in America", Gaskins was convicted of nine murders committed in South Carolina between 1973 and 1975. He was suspected of 31 murders. Two victims had been murdered while Gaskins had been incarcerated; one while Gaskins had been on death row. Later claimed on death row that he had murdered between 80 and 110 victims. Executed in September, 1991.

killers.Name: William Suff
killers.Miscellaneous.information: County store clerk who raped, stabbed, strangled, and sometimes mutilated 12 or more prostitutes in Riverside County. Known as the "Riverside Prostitute Killer" and the "Lake Elsinore Killer".

killers.Name: Maury Travis
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed prostitutes in the St. Louis area from 2000 to 2002. Caught when he mailed an Expedia.com map showing where to find a body to a St. Louis newspaper. Committed suicide in prison.

killers.Name: Kenneth Alessio Bianchi
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of strangling twelve females between ages 12 and 28 and suspected in another three cases. One of the "Hillside Stranglers".[54]

killers.Name: Charles Sobhraj
killers.Miscellaneous.information: French con man known as "The Bikini Killer" or "The Serpent" that targeted Western tourists in vacation spots of South-east Asia, often with the help of female accomplices. Imprisoned in India from 1976 to 1997, and from 2004 serving a life sentence in Nepal.

killers.Name: Joseph Christopher
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Midtown Slasher"; racist who killed 12 people, all but one of them African Americans, in 1980 and 1981, between upstate New York and Georgia, mutilating 2 of them.

killers.Name: "Paraquat murders" killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Series of indiscriminate poisonings carried out in Japan in 1985 where twelve people were killed.

killers.Name: John Justin Bunting
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Ringleader in the Snowtown murders (aka Bodies in the Barrels Murders); sentenced to 11 consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole.

killers.Name: Siswanto
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Alias Robot Gedek. Homeless man that killed 12 boys. Sentenced to death on May 21, 1997. Died in prison on March 26, 2007.

killers.Name: Enriqueta Martí
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Self-proclaimed witch that abducted, prostituted, murdered and made potions with the bodies of small children that she sold in Barcelona. Remains of 12 different children were identified in her home, but she is believed to have murdered more. Murdered in prison by fellow immates while awaiting trial in 1913.

killers.Name: Herb Baumeister
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Strangled gay men and buried their bodies in his backyard in Indiana and Ohio; 11 men were found in the yard but only 5 were identified. Committed suicide when faced with arrest.

killers.Name: Sergey Golovkin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed at least 11 boys in the Moscow area between 1986 and 1992.[55] Last person executed in Russia before the death penalty was abolished.

killers.Name: Juana Barraza
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Female wrestler who bludgeoned or strangled elderly women to rob them.

killers.Name: Jack Unterweger
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Served 14 years in Austrian prison because of a murder in 1974; killed at least 9 prostitutes after his release. Was a small media star in Austrian media in the early 1990s and was arrested in the United States, where he may have killed another 3 prostitutes, on behalf of Austrian police. Hanged himself in 1994 after being sentenced to life in prison.

killers.Name: Vaughn Greenwood
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Skid Row Slasher". Killed 11 people, suspected of 2 more. Cut victims'throats from ear to ear and may have drank their blood.

killers.Name: Benjamin Atkins
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Woodward Corridor Killer". Raped and strangled his victims before abandoning their bodies in vacant buildings.

killers.Name: Nannie Doss
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Responsible for 11 deaths between 1927 and 1954. Known as the "Giggling Nanny", the "Giggling Granny", and the "Jolly Black Widow".

killers.Name: Clifford Olson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Considered a dangerous offender, meaning that Olson could never have been released from prison. He had three parole applications rejected.[56] Died September 30, 2011

killers.Name: Martin Lecián
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Responsible for killing 10 policemen and 1 prison officer. Executed in 1927.

killers.Name: Henri Désiré Landru
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nicknamed "Bluebeard", he put notes in the lonely hearts section of newspapers under different aliases, presenting himself as a widower that wanted to marry a war widow. He killed at least ten women and the teenaged son of one of them, and burned their bodies after he had gained access to their assets. Guillotined.[57]

killers.Name: West Mesa Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Remains of 11 women, who disappeared between 2003 and 2005, found buried in desert in Albuquerque, New Mexico in 2009 and attributed to a bone collector.

killers.Name: Anthony Sowell
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as The Cleveland Strangler, he was convicted of killing 11 women between 2007 and 2009, and is suspected in another series of murders in the 1980s, with the two sets of killings separated by a 15-year stint in prison.

killers.Name: Andre Crawford
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered 11 women between 1993 and 1999. Sentenced to life in prison.

killers.Name: Francisco Garcia Escalero
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Killer Beggar", schizophrenic homeless man confined to a psychiatric hospital after killing 11 prostitutes and other homeless people between 1987 and 1994.

killers.Name: Zhang Yongming
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sold flesh of the victims as ‘ostrich meat’ and kept eyeballs in wine. Executed.

killers.Name: Carlos Eduardo Robledo Puch
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of 11 murders and multiple other crimes including attempted murder and sexual assault. Sentenced to life imprisonment in 1980.

killers.Name: Adnan Çolak
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed eleven elderly women aged 68 to 95 and raped six others. Sentenced to death but changed to life in prison after Turkey abolished the death penalty in 2004.

killers.Name: Seisaku Nakamura
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Teenager serial killer known as the "Hamamatsu Deaf Killer" for being born deaf. Murdered 11 people (including his brother) and attacked many others, among them his father, sister, brother-in-law and nephew. Tried as an adult and executed.

killers.Name: Very Idham Henyansyah
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "singing serial killer" and "Ryan", the artistic name he adopted while awaiting his execution in prison, where he recorded an album and wrote his autobiography. "Ryan" confessed to murdering 11 people including a toddler; 10 of his victims were buried in his parents' home backyard while the last one was butchered and hidden in a suitcase.

killers.Name: Francisco de Assis Pereira
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Rapist and serial killer, known as "O Maníaco do Parque" (The Park Maniac). He was arrested for the torture, rape and death of 11 women and for assaulting nine in a park in São Paulo, Brazil during the 1990s. Pereira found his victims by posing as a talent scout for a modeling agency.

killers.Name: Rudolf Pleil
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Deathmaker". Convicted of killing salesman and nine women. Claimed to have killed 25.

killers.Name: Milton Johnson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Weekend Murderer" killed up to 17 people.[58]

killers.Name: Long Island serial killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Also known as "The Gilgo Killer". Believed to have murdered 10 to 14 people associated with the sex trade over a period of 15 years.

killers.Name: Daniel Lee Siebert
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of 1979 manslaughter; killed ten people across America in three months in mid-1980s including two children and a Southside Slayer victim.[59]

killers.Name: Original Night Stalker
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Also known as "The East Area Rapist". Killer and rapist who murdered ten people in Southern California from 1979 through 1986.

killers.Name: Lonnie David Franklin, Jr.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Grim Sleeper" for the alleged 14-year hiatus he took from murdering between 1988 and 2002. Shot and strangled his victims, mostly women, around South Los Angeles.

killers.Name: Bobbie Joe Long
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Classified Ad Rapist"; killed 10 women in Tampa Bay, Florida in 1984.

killers.Name: Stewart Wilken
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "Boetie Boer"; raped, sodomised and murdered 10 victims from 1990–1997.

killers.Name: David Randitsheni
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Kidnapped 19 people, raped 17, and murdered 10. Sentenced to 16 consecutive life sentences plus 220 years in prison; hanged himself three weeks after conviction.

killers.Name: Edmund Kemper
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A victim of Herbert Mullin was attributed to him originally.[60]

killers.Name: Dennis Rader
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the BTK Killer. Murdered ten people in Sedgwick County (in and around Wichita), Kansas, between 1974 and 1991.

killers.Name: Dorangel Vargas
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Homeless cannibal known as "The People Eater" and "The Hannibal Lecter of the Andes".

killers.Name: Ali Kaya
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "the baby faced killer"; responsible for 10 murders. Escaped from prison and later recaptured.[61]

killers.Name: Robert Joe Wagner
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Secondary ringleader in the Snowtown murders and best friend of John Justin Bunting; sentenced to 10 consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole.

killers.Name: Jeanne Weber
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Transient baby-sitter who strangled children in her care. Declared insane. Hanged herself in prison on July 5, 1918.

killers.Name: Henry Louis Wallace
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to 10 murders in Charlotte, North Carolina.[62]

killers.Name: Angelo Buono
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of strangling ten females. One of the "Hillside Stranglers". Died in prison in 2002.

killers.Name: Oleg Kuznetsov
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 10 women and girls from 1991 to 1992; sentenced to death but later commuted to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Hwaseong killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The victims, women aged 14 to 71, were bound, gagged and strangled to death with their own clothes in most cases. The largest criminal case in South Korea with two million officers mobilized and over 21,000 suspects investigated, but went ultimately unsolved.

killers.Name: Satish
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed ten girls who were between the ages of 5 to 9 years old.

killers.Name: Zhou Kehua
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A former soldier who targeted ATM users. He killed 10 people and evaded the law for 8 years, before being shot in a shootout with police after a year-long manhunt.

killers.Name: Kang Ho Sun
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sentenced to death in 2010 for killing 10 women, including his wife and mother-in-law.[63]

killers.Name: Volker Eckert
killers.Miscellaneous.information: German trucker that confessed to have abducted, tortured and killed 5 prostitutes through his route in Western Europe, plus strangling a 14-years old girl in his native West Germany in 1974, when he was 15. Police considered him perpetrator of 9 murders (with 4 more being possible), but he hanged himself in prison before being convicted.

killers.Name: Peter Kürten
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Charged with nine murders and seven attempted murders. Dubbed "The Vampire of Düsseldorf" by the contemporary media. Executed by guillotine in 1931.

killers.Name: Norman Afzal Simons
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Station Strangler", convicted of only one of 22 cases of murder and sodomy of young children near Cape Town.[64]

killers.Name: Francis Heaulme
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing 9 people, but suspected in the murder of dozens. He is known as the "Criminal Backpacker" due to his travels throughout France. He left a trail of bodies wherever he went.[65]

killers.Name: Joel Rifkin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Drifter",[66] killed prostitutes in New York City, most of them drug addicts. Convicted of nine murders but believed to have committed 17; also suspected of being the unidentified Long Island serial killer.

killers.Name: Dagmar Overbye
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered between 9 and 25 children – of which one was her own – during a seven-year period. On March 3, 1921, she was sentenced to death in one of the most talked about trials in Danish history, that changed legislation on childcare. The sentence was later commuted to life in prison. Overbye was working as a professional child caretaker, caring for babies born outside of marriage, murdering her own charges. She strangled them, drowned them or burned them to death in her masonry heater. The corpses were either cremated, buried or hidden in the loft.

killers.Name: Kenneth McDuff
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Broomstick Killer"; death sentence for 1966 triple-murder commuted; killed three days after 1989 parole and ten further times in Waco, Texas until 1992. Executed by lethal injection by the state of Texas on November 17, 1998.

killers.Name: Robert Joseph Silveria, Jr.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Boxcar Killer"; freight train rider convicted of beating to death fellow transients and confessed to dozens more.

killers.Name: Richard Biegenwald
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Thrill Killer". Killed at least nine people in Monmouth County, New Jersey and is suspected in at least two other murders.[67]

killers.Name: Alexander Bychkov
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Described in his personal diary how he killed 11 men who were alcoholics and tramps. Confessed to eating body parts of his victims. Found guilty of nine murders and sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: New Bedford Highway Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murders of nine women and disappearance of two others between 1988 and 1989.

killers.Name: Edgecombe County Serial Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murders of nine women and disappearance of another since 2005 around Rocky Mount, North Carolina. Antwan Pittman has been convicted in one case.

killers.Name: Sergei Martynov
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of raping and murdering a woman in 1992. Sentenced to life imprisonment for killing eight more women during a violent crime spree between 2005 and 2010.

killers.Name: Anatoly Utkin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "Ulyanovsky maniac"; killed 8 girls and 1 man from 1968 to 1973; executed 1975.

killers.Name: Ondrej Rigo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Slovak serial killer and necrophile who committed his murders during the early 1990s in Slovakia, Germany and the Netherlands. He was arrested in 1992 and received a life sentence in 1994. He remains the murderer with the biggest number of victims in the modern history of Slovakia.

killers.Name: Timothy Krajcir
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to killing nine women, five in Missouri and four others in Illinois and Pennsylvania.

killers.Name: Gilberto Chamba
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Taxi driver known as "The Monster of Machala", between 1988 and 1993 abducted 10 of his passengers (all lone female students) in this Ecuadorian city and killed 8, often raping them after with a stick. Though sentenced to 16 years in prison, he benefitted from an amnesty campaign in 2000 that also cleared his criminal record and moved to Spain, where he was arrested for the rape and murder of another student and the attempted rape and murder of a prostitute in 2004. Sentenced in 2005 to 45 years in prison.

killers.Name: Alfred Gaynor
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Crack cocaine addict. Killed nine women in Massachusetts. Sentenced to life in prison on May 19, 2000.

killers.Name: Mark Goudeau
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Baseline Killer"; convicted of nine murders in Phoenix, Arizona.

killers.Name: Joseph Paul Franklin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to 20 murders and several attempted murders. Executed November 2013.

killers.Name: Yoshio Kodaira
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A serial rapist, Kodaira killed his father-in-law in 1932 and 8 to 10 women in Japan between 1945 and 1946, engaging in necrophilia after the fifth murder. Previously (1920s) he had been deployed to Northern China as a sailor in the Imperial Japanese Navy, where he was free to target the locals. Hanged in 1949.

killers.Name: Keith Hunter Jesperson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Dubbed the "Happy Face Killer", Jesperson was convicted of killing 8 women by strangulation.

killers.Name: Rodney Alcala
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Dating Game Killer" for appearing on the game show The Dating Game in the middle of his killing years. Was convicted of at least five murders, though his actual total is estimated to be much higher. Had a locker filled with thousands of photographs of women and children, most in sexually explicit poses, and it is suspected that some of the women photographed may be among Alcala's additional victims.

killers.Name: Kiyotaka Katsuta
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Strangled or shot people to rob them, using a gun he had stolen from a policeman after running him over with his car. Hanged in 2000.

killers.Name: Christopher Wilder
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed eight women during a spree before accidentally killing himself; suspected in the disappearance and murder of more than 5 more.[68]

killers.Name: Axeman of New Orleans
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killer of at least eight people in the New Orleans area from May 1918 to October 1919.

killers.Name: Gilbert Paul Jordan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Boozing Barber", believed to have committed the "Alcohol murders" killed women by alcohol poisoning; deceased (2006).

killers.Name: Frankford Slasher
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Allegedly responsible for nine murders in the Frankford neighborhood of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania; Leonard Christopher was convicted of one murder; another murder was committed in same style while he was incarcerated; believed to still be at large.

killers.Name: Kendall Francois
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Admitted to killing eight prostitutes in Poughkeepsie, New York, but denied involvement with the disappearance of a ninth prostitute.

killers.Name: John Edward Robinson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Slavemaster"; lured victims through the internet.

killers.Name: Eric Edgar Cooke
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nicknamed "The Night Caller", he terrorized the city of Perth assaulting 22 people at random with various means, killing eight of them. Hanged in 1964.

killers.Name: Marie Noe
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered eight of her children between 1949 and 1968.

killers.Name: Gary C. Evans
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Befriended the Son of Sam killer while incarcerated. Released in 1984, he proceeded to burglarize and kill while in and out of jails for over 13 years. Aided investigators in a high profile murder case before dodging parole and being chased. The manhunt finally ended when he jumped to his death off a bridge.

killers.Name: Colonial Parkway Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Believed to have murdered at least eight people in Virginia between 1986 and 1989; left three couples dead and one couple missing and presumed dead.

killers.Name: Michael Bruce Ross
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Ross confessed to all of the murders, and was convicted of four of them. He was executed by the state of Connecticut on May 13, 2005 by lethal injection, making it the first execution in Connecticut and the whole of New England since 1960.

killers.Name: Marybeth Tinning
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Suffocated eight of her nine children during the 1970s. One daughter died of natural causes shortly after birth, the first of the Tinning children to die.

killers.Name: Sean Vincent Gillis
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Kidnapped, raped, and mutilated the corpses of Louisiana women.[69][70][71]

killers.Name: John Christie
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Gassed, strangled and in some cases raped eight women (one of them his wife) in his flat of Notting Hill, London. Prior to Christie's arrest, one of his victims was attributed to the victim's father, who was hanged after a trial where Christie declared as a witness. The controversy generated led to the abolition of the death penalty in the United Kingdom.

killers.Name: Genzo Kurita
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Serial rapist and murderer, engaging in necrophilia in two of his murders. Two other victims were the children of the woman he targeted, who Kurita threw off a cliff (a third child survived). Hanged in 1959.

killers.Name: Kiyoshi Okubo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped and murdered eight women aged 17 to 21 upon his release from prison, where he had been for previous rapes. Hanged in 1976.

killers.Name: Paul Ogorzow
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "S-Bahn murderer"; SA sergeant convicted of raping and murdering eight women by throwing them off trains in Berlin during blackouts in 1941 and 1942. Executed by guillotine at the Plötzensee Prison on July 26, 1941.

killers.Name: Vladimir Mukhankin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The pupil of Chikatilo"; he killed 8 women.

killers.Name: Nikolai Dzhumagaliev
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Lured women in a park at night and hacked them with an axe as part of a plan to rid the world of prostitution. Also cooked parts of his victims and ate them himself or served them to other people as part of ethnic dishes. Found innocent for reason of insanity and interned in a mental institution.

killers.Name: Manuel Delgado Villegas
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Wandering criminal known as "El Arropiero" (The Arrope Trader) and "El Estrangulador del Puerto" (The Strangler of Puerto), confessed to the impulsive murders of 48 people of different gender, age, and sexual orientation in three countries (including his girlfriend, which he strangled during sex), though police only investigated him for 22 murders in Spain and was considered proven author of 7. Some of his victims were killed with hand to hand combat techniques that he had learned in the Spanish Foreign Legion. Diagnosed with XYY syndrome and interned in a mental institution until his death in 1998.

killers.Name: Harrison Graham
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing seven women in Philadelphia and keeping their bodies in his apartment.[72]

killers.Name: Ivan Milat
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of the Backpacker murders; sentenced to seven consecutive life sentences plus 18 years without the possibility of parole. May have had accomplices.

killers.Name: Michael Wayne McGray
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of the murder of 6 people in the late 1990s, including a woman and her 11-year-old daughter. Claims to have killed 11 others. In 2010, killed a cellmate.

killers.Name: Kenneth Erskine
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Stockwell Stranger", he was a burglar who raped and strangled at least 7 elderly women after breaking into their home.

killers.Name: David Carpenter
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Trailside Killer"; murdered women on San Francisco-area hiking trails between 1979 and 1981. Sentenced to death.

killers.Name: Derrick Todd Lee
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Baton Rouge or South Louisiana Serial Killer" convicted of three murders, sentenced to death by lethal injection. Believed to have murdered several other women in Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama.

killers.Name: Peter Manuel
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A US-born Scottish burglar and serial killer who was convicted of murdering seven people across Lanarkshire between 1956 and 1958, believed to have killed a further two. Manuel was the third-last prisoner to be hanged in Scotland, after a sensational trial in which he conducted his own defence.

killers.Name: Terry Blair
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Kansas City serial killer and rapist; active 1982–2004. Sentenced to life.

killers.Name: Doug Clark
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Boiler operator who killed prostitutes in Los Angeles. One of the "Sunset Strip Killers".

killers.Name: Stanisław Modzelewski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Vampire of Gałkówek". Confessed to strangling eight women, but convicted of seven because one of the bodies was never found. Hanged.

killers.Name: Michael Hughes
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed six women and a schoolgirl in the South Los Angeles area between 1986 and 1993.

killers.Name: Daniel Audiel López Martínez
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed five women and two men in Ciudad Juarez between 1998 and 2008. Sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Santa Rosa Hitchhiker Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "Santa Rosa Hitchhiker Murders": Series of at least seven unsolved homicides involving female hitchhikers that took place in Sonoma County and Santa Rosa of the North Bay area of California in 1972 and 1973.

killers.Name: Carlton Gary
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Stocking Strangler". Convicted of the murders of seven elderly women in Georgia. Sentenced to death.

killers.Name: Roger Kibbe
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The I-5 Strangler", killed 7 women between 1977 and 1987. 6 along I-5 near Sacramento, and one in Walnut Creek, California. He was tried for the Walnut Creek murder by the Grand Jury before the body was found but in exchange for helping to find the body Kibbe was spared the death penalty and received life in prison. It took detectives 34 years to find the body.

killers.Name: Connecticut River Valley Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Believed responsible for a series of similar knife murders mostly in and around Claremont, New Hampshire, and the Connecticut River Valley, primarily in the 1980s.

killers.Name: Darren Deon Vann
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to the murders of at least seven women.

killers.Name: Motta Navas
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Active in Kollam, Kerala, Navas was arrested and imprisoned for his first two murders in 1996 and 2007. During his final crime spree in 2012, he bludgeoned to death five elderly pavement dwellers in their sleep, always after midnight. He feigned a mental illness to avoid suspicion by the police in at least two occasions.

killers.Name: Ripper Jayanandan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed seven people during robberies. Sentenced to death.

killers.Name: Sataro Fukiage
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed seven girls aged 11 to 16 and raped between 93 and 100. Hanged in 1926.

killers.Name: Václav Mrázek
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 7 women in Chomutov. Executed in 1957.

killers.Name: Paul Dennis Reid
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Reid killed the employees of restaurants he targeted for a series of robberies.

killers.Name: Joseph Taborsky
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Joseph "Mad Dog" Taborsky was sentenced to death after brutal robberies and murders in Connecticut during the 1950s.

killers.Name: Roberto Succo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: In 1986 he escaped the mental hospital where he was recluded in for murdering his parents five years earlier and began a crime spree in Europe that included burglary, hijacking, kidnapping, rape and murder and earned him the Public Enemy Number One spot in Italy, France and Switzerland. Committed suicide in prison after failing to escape a second time.

killers.Name: Émile Louis
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Bus driver that preyed on young handicapped women (seven murders) in the 1970s. Sentenced to life in prison on November 25, 2004.

killers.Name: Guy Georges
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Beast of the Bastille"; serving a life sentence for seven murders between 1991 and 1997.

killers.Name: Paul Steven Haigh
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sentenced to life imprisonment without parole for the murders of seven people in Victoria.

killers.Name: Anatoly Slivko
killers.Miscellaneous.information: As a member of the Young Pioneers (Soviet Boy Scouts), Slivko gained the trust of 43 young boys over almost three decades, asphyxiated them until they fell unconscious, and then ritually molested, filmed, photographed and resuscitated them. The seven boys that didn't wake up were dismembered and burned. Minutes before his execution in 1989, police asked Slivko for advice in the investigation of Andrei Chikatilo's crimes.

killers.Name: Aleksey Sukletin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Alligator"; killed and cannibalized at least 7 girl and women from 1979 to 1985; executed 1987.

killers.Name: Christopher Peterson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Shotgun Killer", later changed name Obadyah Ben-Yisrayl, confessed to shooting seven people with a shotgun in a killing spree spanning from October 30, 1990 to December 18, 1990 in Indiana. Sentenced to death, commuted to life.

killers.Name: Cincinnati Strangler
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped and strangled seven mostly elderly women in Cincinnati, Ohio between 1965 and 1966. Believed to be Posteal Laskey, who was convicted of one murder and died in prison on May 29, 2007.

killers.Name: Paul Durousseau
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered seven young women (including two who were pregnant) in the southeast United States. Sentenced to death on December 13, 2007.

killers.Name: Samuel Sidyno
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Capital Hill Serial Killer" murdered 7 people in Pretoria from 1998–1999.

killers.Name: Sibusiso Duma
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered 7 people in the Pietermaritzburg area of KwaZulu Natal in 2007.

killers.Name: Walter E. Ellis
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Milwaukee North Side Strangler"; convicted of killing 7 prostitutes in Wisconsin between 1986 and 2007. Died in prison on December 1, 2013.

killers.Name: Tommy Lynn Sells
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Drifter active throughout the U.S. who specialized in killing children and multiple victims after breaking into their homes. Caught when a 10-year-old girl survived his attack and provided a description of him. Executed in Texas on April 3, 2014.

killers.Name: Władysław Mazurkiewicz
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Gentleman Killer". Indicted of, and confessed to having committed 30 murders; convicted of 6 and hanged in 1957.

killers.Name: Robert Pickton
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Found guilty of six counts of second-degree murder. Accused of murdering 20 other women, most of them prostitutes and drug dealers. Comments by Pickton suggest that the total may be 49.

killers.Name: Gong Runbo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Found guilty of the murders of six children and teenagers aged between nine and 16 from 2005 to 2006; executed 2007.

killers.Name: John Wayne Glover
killers.Miscellaneous.information: British ex-pat living in Australia. Known by the media as "The Granny Killer" as he targeted elderly women; committed suicide while in prison in 2005.

killers.Name: Joseph Naso
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A freelance photographers who raped and strangled to death women in California. Arrested in 2011 and sentenced to death two years later. Known as "The Double Initial Killer" since first four victims to be identified bore double initials.

killers.Name: John George Haigh
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called the "Acid Bath Murderer" for dissolving his victims in sulphuric acid under the belief that he could not be prosecuted for murder if no body was found. He would then forge papers to sell the victims possessions. Confessed nine murders, convicted of six and hanged.

killers.Name: Aileen Carol Wuornos
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed strangers, all men, along Florida highways over 13 months while working as a prostitute.

killers.Name: Jack the Stripper
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered at least six prostitutes in London and may have been responsible for the deaths of two others before that. Remains unidentified.

killers.Name: James Miller
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sentenced to six consecutive terms of life imprisonment with a non-parole period of 35 years. Died of cancer in 2008.

killers.Name: Morris Solomon Jr.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Handyman who killed six young women between 1986 and 1987 in Sacramento, California. Sentenced to death on September 16, 1992.

killers.Name: Robert Berdella
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Berdella abducted, raped, tortured, and murdered at least six men.

killers.Name: Mack Ray Edwards
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Molester. Murdered 2 young girls and 4 young boys. Claimed at one point to have killed as many as 18.

killers.Name: Eugen Weidmann
killers.Miscellaneous.information: German who strangled and robbed American dancer Jean de Koven, shot a former accomplice, and shot dead and robbed four other people around Paris in 1937.

killers.Name: Celine Lesage
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed seven of her newborn babies and sentenced to 15 years in prison.

killers.Name: Filiberto Hernández Martínez
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed six people from 2010 to 2013 in Tamuín.

killers.Name: Richard Trenton Chase
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Schizophrenic known as "The "Vampire of Sacramento", he was convicted of six murders performed in the span of a month after being released of a psychiatric hospital where he had been committed for killing and eating the raw meat of several animals. In addition to killing his victims, he often raped the women's bodies and drank their blood, or took their organs home and ate them.

killers.Name: David Berkowitz
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The "Son of Sam", he would shoot couples in their cars, killing six and wounding seven.

killers.Name: Samuel Bongani Mfeka
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 6 women from 1993 to 1996 and sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Nicholas Lungisa Ncama
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered 6 people in the Eastern Cape, 1997.

killers.Name: Leslie Irvin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Mad Dog Killer"; Killed six people in robberies in the mid-1950s; his Supreme Court case set a precedent for fair trials of highly publicized defendants.

killers.Name: Aleksandr Rubel
killers.Miscellaneous.information: He was intoxicated on gasoline vapour during his murders. Sentenced as a minor to the maximum punishment allowed by law — eight years imprisonment — he was released in 2006.

killers.Name: András Pándy
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Former clergyman nicknamed "Father Bluebeard", killed his two wives and four of his children with the help of a fifth he was having an incestuous affair with, and whom denounced him to the authorities seven years later. Sentenced to life imprisonment in 2002.

killers.Name: Dayton Leroy Rogers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed street women, usually addicts, prostitutes and runaways. He would tie, rape, and kill them in a forest.

killers.Name: Alfredo Galán
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called "The Deck of Cards Killer". A former corporal in the Spanish Army, he ambushed random people and shot them in the head or back at very close range, using always a Tokarev TT-33 handgun that he had acquired while stationed in Bosnia. Three other victims survived. After each attack he would leave a marked playing card as his signature. Sentenced to 142 years in prison after surrendering himself voluntarily to justice.

killers.Name: Rory Enrique Conde
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Tamiami Trail Strangler". Killed 6 prostitutes in Florida. Sentenced to death on March 7, 2000.

killers.Name: Rhonda Belle Martin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Alabama poisoner who murdered six family members; executed in 1957.

killers.Name: Nathaniel White
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of stabbing to death six women in the Hudson Valley, New York area from 1991 to 1992.

killers.Name: Lemuel Smith
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to the murders of five people, including an on-duty female prison guard. Sentenced to death on June 10, 1983. Conmmuted to life in 1984.

killers.Name: Freeway Phantom
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped and strangled six young women and girls in Washington, D.C. in the early 1970s, dumping their bodies by freeways.

killers.Name: David Mason
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Strangled four elderly neighbors, his cellmate when imprisoned on lesser charges; shot his boyfriend.

killers.Name: Cleophus Prince Jr.
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Clairemont Killer"; raped and killed six women in San Diego in 1990.

killers.Name: Gary Ray Bowles
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Beat and strangled six men to death to steal their credit cards in 1994.

killers.Name: Friedrich Schumann
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed six people and executed in 1921.

killers.Name: Norbert Poehlke
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Hammer-Killer", German police officer who was found, after his suicide in 1985, to have committed several bank robberies and murders.

killers.Name: Wolfgang Schmidt
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Beast of Beelitz". Killed five women and a 3 month old baby from 1989 to 1991. Currently in a psychiatric hospital.

killers.Name: Richard Cottingham
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killer operating in New York and New Jersey who often targeted prostitutes and utilized mutilation as well as dismemberment in his killings. Known as the "Torso Killer", convicted of five murders. He made claims of victim count as up to a hundred, however, there was no evidence to support this and is considered unsubstantiated.

killers.Name: Zodiac Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Targeted young couples. Remains unsolved but open in the California jurisdictions the 5 certain Zodiac murders occurred. Potentially 37 total victims claimed but unverified.[73]

killers.Name: John Floyd Thomas
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Serial murderer and rapist with one of the longest criminal careers in the US.

killers.Name: Carl Panzram
killers.Miscellaneous.information: From 1920 to 1928, he claimed in a posthumous autobiography to have committed over 22 killings, and sodomy of more than 1,000 young men. Hanged on September 5, 1930.

killers.Name: Steve Wright
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Referred to as "Suffolk murders", "Ipswich murders", "Ipswich Ripper", "Suffolk Ripper", "Suffolk Strangler", "East Anglia Ripper", "Red Light Ripper" and "the Suffolkator". Murdered five prostitutes, all of whom worked in Ipswich in 2006. There are possible links to previous Suffolk prostitute killings.

killers.Name: Hubert Pilčík
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Made money smuggling people across the Czechoslovakia-Germany border, but killed most of his customers.

killers.Name: William Patrick Fyfe
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing five women in the Montreal area of Quebec, although he claims to have killed four others. Serving a life sentence in West Canada.

killers.Name: Melvin Rees
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Sex Beast"; shot and defiled a woman in 1957, torture-murdered a family of four in 1959 and suspected in four other killings.

killers.Name: David Maust
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed teenage boys; caught when bodies of three boys were found in the concrete floor of his basement in Hammond, Indiana. Committed suicide in prison in 2006.

killers.Name: Danny Rolling
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Gainesville Ripper"; murdered five students in August 1990. Executed on October 6, 2006. Shortly before his execution, he gave a handwritten confession to authorities for a triple homicide of an elderly man, his adult daughter, and young grandson that occurred years earlier in Rolling's hometown of Shreveport, LA. Although Rolling was never officially charged or extradicted to LA to stand trial for the "Grissom Murders", Shreveport Police had confirmed even before the confession that Rolling had long been considered the lone suspect and the case was closed.

killers.Name: Allan Joseph Legere
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing five people in the Miramichi area, New Brunswick. Legere is now serving a life sentence Canada's only super maximum prison (Special Handling Unit).

killers.Name: Joseph E. Duncan III
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing a California boy in 1997 and 4 members of an Idaho family in 2005. Confessed to two 1996 murders in Washington state, but has not been formally charged. Currently on U.S. federal death row.

killers.Name: Stephen Akinmurele
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Cul-de-sac Killer". Considered mentally ill, Akinmurele had a "pathological hatred" of old people and had committed crimes against them since he was 11. Killed himself in prison.

killers.Name: Vincent Johnson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Brooklyn Strangler".

killers.Name: Harvey Carignan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Want-Ad Killer"; raped and beat 4 young women to death in 1972 and 1973; escaped hanging for a 1949 killing on a technicality.

killers.Name: Edward Edwards
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Shot a young couple in 1977 and stabbed and strangled another in 1980; died months prior to execution on April 7, 2011 for shooting his foster son in 1996 insurance murder.

killers.Name: Vinko Pintarić
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered five people, including his wife, between 1973 and 1990. Escaped from custody three times, killed in a 1991 shootout with the police.

killers.Name: William Dathan Holbert
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "Wild Bill"; American expatriate who had the bodies of five other Americans buried on his property. He would kill people to get their money and properties. His wife, Laura Michelle Reese, was also arrested.[75]

killers.Name: Elisabeth Wiese
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Angel Maker of St. Pauli"; baby farmer who poisoned her grandchild and four others with morphine and burned their bodies in a stove in 1902 and 1903.

killers.Name: Phantom Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Believed to have committed the Texarkana Moonlight Murders in Texas between February 23 and May 4, 1946.

killers.Name: Thomas Dillon
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Shot five men in southeastern Ohio: one while jogging, two deer hunting and two fishing.

killers.Name: San Mateo slasher
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Gypsy Hill killings"; five unsolved killings, of young women in San Mateo County, California during early 1976.

killers.Name: Honolulu Strangler
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped and strangled five young women in Hawaii in 1985 and 1986.

killers.Name: Anthony Kirkland
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Kirkland murdered four females between 2006 and 2009, three of them children, following a 16-year prison term for the murder of another woman.

killers.Name: William MacDonald
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered derelicts in Sydney and Brisbane between 1960 and 1962; sentenced to five consecutive life sentences.

killers.Name: Marc Dutroux
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Serial killer convicted of having kidnapped, tortured and sexually abused six girls ranging in age from 8 to 19, four of whom he murdered; also tortured and murdered his accomplice, Bernard Weinstein.

killers.Name: Harry Powers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "Lonely Hearts" swindler and conman. Killed two women and three children in Quiet Dell, West Virginia. Arrested after the bodies were found buried near his garage in 1931 and hanged in 1932.

killers.Name: Anna Marie Hahn
killers.Miscellaneous.information: German-born murder-for-profit killer who poisoned five elderly men; executed in 1938.

killers.Name: Robert Nixon
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 5 women in the 1930s with bricks. Executed by electrocution in Illinois on June 15, 1939.

killers.Name: Waneta Hoyt
killers.Miscellaneous.information: New York woman who murdered her five children.

killers.Name: Janie Lou Gibbs
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Georgia poisoner who killed five family members. Sentenced to life. Died in prison on February 7, 2010.

killers.Name: South Dade Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Flat-Tire murders". Killed 5 women in 1975.

killers.Name: Gerald Parker
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Bedroom Basher" raped and murdered five women and killed the unborn baby of a sixth woman in Orange County, California.

killers.Name: Phillip Carl Jablonski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: convicted of killing five women in California and Utah between 1978 and 1991. Sentenced to death in 1994.

killers.Name: Arthur Gary Bishop
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Utah man who murdered five young boys; executed in 1988.

killers.Name: Faryion Wardrip
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed five young women around Wichita Falls, Texas between 1984 and 1986.

killers.Name: Timothy Wilson Spencer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Southside Strangler"; raped and killed five women in Virginia. Executed in the electric chair on April 27, 1994.

killers.Name: Gary Evans
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Antique thief who shot to death two shop owners and three accomplices who he suspected of stealing from him between 1985 and 1997.

killers.Name: Robert Shulman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of murdering five prostitutes between 1991 and 1996.

killers.Name: Elias Abuelazam
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Serial Slasher". Israeli-Arab immigrant that stabbed victims to death. Sentenced to life on June 25, 2012.

killers.Name: Joachim Knychała
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Vampire of Bytom" or "Frankenstein", who murdered five women between 1975 and 1982.[76]

killers.Name: Archibald Hall
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called "The Monster Butler". Died in prison in 2002.

killers.Name: Colin Ireland
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called "The Gay Slayer". A highly organized serial killer, Ireland picked passive masochist gay men in the Coleherne public house, accompanied them home, and murdered them after they were voluntarily restrained. He then cleaned the house of forensic evidence and left when he was sure of not appearing suspicious.

killers.Name: Claude Lastennet
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of murdering 5 old women between August 1993 and January 1994.[77]

killers.Name: Metod Trobec
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped, killed and cremated five women in his home. Also tried to murder two other immates while in prison before committing suicide in his cell in 2006.

killers.Name: Romulus Vereş
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Hammer Man". Institutionalized.

killers.Name: Willem van Eijk
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Beast of Harkstede".

killers.Name: Akira Nishiguchi
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Fraudster, murdered two people while engaging in confidence scams and killed three others while on the run from justice. Hanged in 1970.

killers.Name: Boris Gusakov
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "Student Hunter"; committed 15 sexual assaults, including 5 murders, on girls and young women from 1964 to 1968.

killers.Name: Anatoly Biryukov
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Hunter of Babies": responsible for the kidnappings and subsequent murders of five infants from Moscow in the fall of 1977.

killers.Name: Süleyman Aktaş
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Nailing Killer": responsible for the murders of five people in 1986 and 1994.

killers.Name: B1 Butcher
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered at least five women between 2005 and 2007, with all murders related to the National Road B1.

killers.Name: Max Gufler
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing four women and suspected of at least 18 murders.

killers.Name: Baekuni
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed street children. Sentenced to life in prison on October 5, 2010.

killers.Name: Angus Sinclair
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of the murders of four females; believed to have murdered eight.

killers.Name: Tony Costa
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Dismembered and mutilated 4 women in Cape Cod in the late 1960s; linked to at least 4 other deaths and disappearances.

killers.Name: Robert Rozier
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Former NFL player that was convicted of four murders but confessed to seven as a member of the Nation of Yahweh.

killers.Name: Leonard Fraser
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Serial rapist and pedophile who murdered four women in Rockhampton. Sentenced to five consecutive life sentences plus 25 years without the possibility of parole; died in prison of a heart attack in 2007.

killers.Name: Ricardo Caputo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Was #1 of the FBI Ten Most Wanted Fugitives during his time as a fugitive in the 1980s. Surrendered himself to justice in 1994 and died of cardiac arrest in prison three years later.

killers.Name: Robert Black
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of kidnapping, raping and murdering four girls aged between 5 and 11. Suspect in other earlier child murders in the UK and other European countries. Died weeks before he was to be charged with a fifth child murder.[78]

killers.Name: Anthony Allen Shore
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Tourniquet Killer"; convicted of strangling a woman with an unusual ligature in 1992 and confessed to killing three girls including two with same MO.

killers.Name: Daytona Beach killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered four, possibly five, women in Daytona Beach, Florida between 2005 and 2007.

killers.Name: Jozef Slovák
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Suspected by investigators of more murders, but only four could be proven.

killers.Name: Monster of Udine
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed at least 4 victims in the Province of Udine, Italy.[79]

killers.Name: John Martin Crawford
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted in 1996 for the murders of three native women.

killers.Name: Oakland County Child Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Also known as "The Babysitter". Responsible for the murders of four or more children in Oakland County, Michigan in 1976 and 1977.

killers.Name: Dallen Bounds
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 4 people in South Carolina. After killing two acquaintances, he barricaded himself with two women and committed suicide on December 23, 1999.

killers.Name: Wayne Adam Ford
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to murdering four women; believed to have killed others.

killers.Name: Heinrich Pommerenke
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed four women.

killers.Name: Caroline Grills
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Poisoned four people (most of them relatives) with thallium hidden in tea and scones she had given them in Sydney. Sentenced to five consecutive life sentences (including one for attempting to poison another family member); died from peritonitis in 1960.

killers.Name: Arnold Sodeman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Also called the "Schoolgirl Strangler", because he preyed on girls between the ages of 8-12. He lured at least two of his victims by offering to buy them ice cream and offered another victim a ride on his bicycle. Convicted and hanged in 1936.

killers.Name: Gordon Cummins
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped three of his victims and robbed the remaining one. Also attacked two other women. Sentenced to death by hanging.

killers.Name: Marc Sappington
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Schizophrenic serial killer who heard voices telling him to kill after extended daily PCP use. He cannibalized part of his last victim.

killers.Name: James Vlassakis
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Snowtown murderer and stepson of John Justin Bunting; sentenced to four consecutive life sentences with a non-parole period of 26 years.

killers.Name: Peter Woodcock
