killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sexual sadist and child rapist. Killed three young children in Toronto in the 1950s. Sentenced to a psychiatric facility, where he murdered a fellow inmate in 1991.

killers.Name: Léopold Dion
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Monster of Port-Rouge". Canadian sex offender and serial killer who was active in Quebec. Sentenced to hang but stabbed to death on November 17, 1972 by fellow inmate named Normand “Lawrence d'Arabie” Champagne, who was found not guilty by reason of insanity.

killers.Name: Lam Kor-wan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Taxi driver and one of Hong Kong's only two known serial killers. Famous for keeping body parts in his parents' home.

killers.Name: Kathleen Folbigg
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Mother convicted of murdering her three infant children and the manslaughter of a fourth child. Sentenced to 30 years imprisonment with a non-parole period of 25 years.

killers.Name: David Meirhofer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed three children and an ex-girlfriend between 1967 and 1974; first serial killer apprehended by offender profiling.

killers.Name: Jerry Brudos
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Electronics technician who bludgeoned and strangled four young women while dressed up in women's clothing. Known as the "Lust Killer" and "Shoe Fetish Slayer".

killers.Name: Erno Soto
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Stabbed young boys and cut off their genitals in attempt to transform them into girls in East Harlem and on the Upper West Side of New York. Known as "Charlie Chop-Off".

killers.Name: William Henry Hance
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Forces Of Evil"; soldier who killed four women around military bases in 1977 and 1978.

killers.Name: Thor Nis Christiansen
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Shot dead and committed necrophilia on 4 young women in Isla Vista, California in the late 1970s. Stabbed to death in prison on March 30, 1981; killer unknown.

killers.Name: Craig Price
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Warwick Slasher"; teenager who stabbed two women and two children in Rhode Island in the late 1980s.

killers.Name: James Swann
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as The Shotgun Stalker; killed 4 and injured 5 in Washington D.C. in 1993.

killers.Name: Cary Stayner
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Yosemite Killer". Killed four women in Yosemite, California. Sentenced to death. Brother of kidnapping victim Steven Stayner.

killers.Name: Scott Lee Kimball
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "Joe Snitch"; FBI informant who pleaded guilty to two of at least four murders in Colorado including those of his uncle and three female acquaintances.

killers.Name: Eastbound Strangler
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed four women in October and November 2006 in Atlantic City, NJ. Each was placed about sixty feet apart in a drainage ditch filled with shallow water. They were facing east and missing their socks.

killers.Name: Tsutomu Miyazaki
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Mutilated and killed four girls, aged between four and seven, and sexually molested their corpses. He drank the blood of one victim and ate her hands.

killers.Name: Raúl Osiel Marroquín
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called "The Sadist". Lured men in gay bars and strangled them, abandoning their bodies inside suitcases all over Mexico City. Two other victims were released after demanding a ransom from their families.

killers.Name: Frank Gust
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Kill four women form 1994 to 1998. Sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Fritz Honka
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered four women in Hamburg and kept the bodies in his apartment. Sentenced to life in prison in 1975, released in 1993, and died on October 19, 1998.

killers.Name: Jürgen Bartsch
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed four, one escaped; died by wrongful overdose during castration surgery.

killers.Name: Cayetano Santos Godino
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as Petiso Orejudo ("the Big-eared Midget"). Teenage arsonist, animal killer and child murderer with congenital syphilis. Arrested at age 16 in 1912 for killing 4 children, although he tried to kill seven more, the first one when he was seven himself. Interned in 1913 in a reformatory, where he tried to kill other immates, and from 1915 in prison. Died in jail in 1948.

killers.Name: Peter Moore
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Stabbed and mutilated four men. Imprisoned for life since 1996.

killers.Name: John Cooper
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Armed robber and rapist. Murdered two couples.

killers.Name: Steven Grieveson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered four boys in an attempt to conceal his homosexuality.

killers.Name: Michael Lupo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called himself "The Wolf Man". Murdered four men after being diagnosed with HIV, died in prison in 1995.

killers.Name: Robert Maudsley
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed three fellow inmates while being held in a mental institution for his first murder. In solitary confinement since 1983.

killers.Name: Donald Neilson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Armed robber and murderer known as the "Black Panther". Died in prison in 2011.

killers.Name: Colin Norris
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse convicted of killing four patients in Leeds hospitals.

killers.Name: Dale Cregan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sentenced to a whole life order in prison for four counts of homicide involving the use of firearms—including killing two police officers—and three separate counts of attempted murder.[80]

killers.Name: Alexander Tchayka
killers.Miscellaneous.information: All the victims were women wearing fur coats and were stabbed multiple times (21 in one case).

killers.Name: Wayne Boden
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "the Vampire Rapist" killed 4 women between 1968–1971; died in prison 2006

killers.Name: Cody Legebokoff
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Committed four murders from 2009 to 2010.

killers.Name: Ion Rîmaru
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Vampire of Bucharest". Attacked 15 lone waitresses as they returned from work with a hammer, hatchet, knife or iron bar, always after midnight and under unusual weather (snowstorms, fog, hard rain, etc.). Four were killed.

killers.Name: Peter Lundin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed his mother in 1991, then killed his mistress and her two children 9 years later; Sentenced to prison.

killers.Name: Hiroaki Hidaka
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed and robbed four women. Hanged in 2006.

killers.Name: Nicolai Bonner
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Born in Moldova, Bonner beat to death four fellow immigrants from the former Soviet Union, three of whom were homeless, and then tried to set them on fire. Sentenced to life imprisonment in 2007.

killers.Name: John Ingvar Lövgren
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to four murders committed between 1958 and 1963 in the Stockholm region.

killers.Name: Robert Ben Rhoades
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of murdering 3 women in Texas and Illinois between 1989 and 1990. Sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Billy Glaze
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "Butcher Knife Billy". Killer convicted of raping and murdering three Native American prostitutes in Minneapolis in 1986 and 1987.

killers.Name: Bertha Gifford
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Found not guilty by reason on insanity of three arsenic poisonings by insanity and suspected of 14 other killings, mostly children, in Missouri.

killers.Name: Ronald Janssen
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Teacher who killed 3. Linked to 15 other killings, usually the rape and murder of young women. Sentenced to life in 2011.[81]

killers.Name: Stephen Griffiths
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known to have killed 3 prostitutes, but claims to have killed 14 to beat "Yorkshire Ripper" Peter Sutcliffe. Dubbed himself the "Crossbow Cannibal" as he killed his victims with a hammer and crossbow and then later ate parts of them.

killers.Name: Peter Tobin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Scottish rapist and serial killer known to have killed at least three young women. Also a suspect in the Bible John murders, committed in Glasgow during the late 1960s.

killers.Name: Koos Hertogs
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Dutch serial killer convicted of abducting, torturing, raping and killing three girls. Suspected of killing a further 3 to 9 girls and young women in the 1970s.

killers.Name: Dorothea Montalvo Puente
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Ran a boarding house in Sacramento where she poisoned tenants and buried them in the yard in order to steal their social security checks.

killers.Name: Albert Fish
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted and executed for the kidnapping, rape, murder and cannibalization of three children in New York, suspected of the deaths of six more children and teenagers. Likely insane (though his insanity plea was denied to make possible his execution), Fish boasted that he "had children in every state" and at one point claimed 100 victims.

killers.Name: Theodore Kaczynski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Also known as the Unabomber, Kaczynski lived isolated in Montana before his arrest in 1998, sending mail bombs and reactive bombs all over the country to anyone who had a pro-technological stance. Federal authorities were informed of Kaczynski's possible involvement by his brother when he recognized the writing of the Unabomber Manifesto in the New York Times.

killers.Name: Pierre Chanal
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing 3 young men between 1980 and 1987. Committed suicide in 2003.

killers.Name: Michael Lee Lockhart
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Multi-state serial killer who received death sentences in three states (Florida, Indiana, and Texas). He was executed in 1997 in Texas.

killers.Name: Michael Gargiulo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Dubbed the "Chiller Killer" and AKA the "Hollywood Ripper" whose killing sprees spanned from 1993–2000 in Chicago and 2001–2008 in Santa Monica, CA and Los Angeles, CA area. Notable for killing Ashton Kutcher's former girlfriend Ashley Ellerin

killers.Name: Peter Dupas
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sexual sadist from Melbourne, who murdered three women and is suspected of at least three further killings. Was convicted of 16 separate acts of sexual violence before his first murder charge. Serving three consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole.

killers.Name: Patrick Mackay
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Burglar suspect of 12 violent murders during robberies, charged with five and convicted of three. Bragged that he had killed 11 people. In prison for life.

killers.Name: Judy Buenoano
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Poisoned her husband, boyfriend and son with arsenic; drowned the son in 1980 but caught in 1983 after poisoning and car bombing a fiancee.

killers.Name: Paul Kenneth Bernardo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The "Scarborough Rapist", later gained national infamy when he moved into torturing and killing teenage girls, assisted by his wife, Karla Homolka.

killers.Name: Paul Denyer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The "Frankston Killer", sentenced to three consecutive life sentences with a non-parole period of 30 years.

killers.Name: Bandali Debs
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of the murder of Kirsty Harty at Upper Beaconsfield in 1997, and of the Moorabbin Police murders 14 months later to avoid arrest for a string of armed robberies; sentenced to three consecutive life sentences plus 27 years without the possibility of parole.

killers.Name: Martin Ney
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Wore a mask while killing 3 and sexually assaulting at least 40 children.

killers.Name: Elfriede Blauensteiner
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Black Widow". Poisoned victims and inherited possessions. Died from a brain tumor on 18 November 2003 in a Vienna Hospital.

killers.Name: Gordon Northcott
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Pedophile who abducted and murdered boys aged between 10 and 12 in Los Angeles and then disposed of the bodies with the help of his mother, Sarah Louise Northcott, and his underage nephew Sanford Clark, whom Northcott had repeatedly threatened and sexually abused. Police considered Northcott a suspect in the disappearance of as many as 20 missing boys in the area that Northcott admitted to have molested, but not murdered; one of these boys surfaced years later alive and confirmed Northcott's version. According to Clark, only four boys were held and murdered in Northcott's property; the three LA children whose remains were found and for whom Northcott was hanged, and an unidentified Mexican boy that Northcott beheaded and disposed of the body near La Puente, California.

killers.Name: Vlado Taneski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A crime journalist, Taneski came under suspicion when his articles on the rape and murder of three elderly women included information that had not been disclosed by the police. All the victims were poor, uneducated cleaners and knew Taneski's mother. Taneski killed himself in prison before he could be interrogated for the murder of a fourth woman.

killers.Name: Peter Kudzinowski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted and executed for the murder of an adult in Scranton, Pennsylvania and two children in New Jersey. Also suspect in the death of two other children in New York City, although Albert Fish later confessed to have murdered one of them himself.

killers.Name: Harvey Glatman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Lonely Hearts Killer"; Californian rapist and killer; lured women to pose for "bondage photographs"; executed in the gas chamber on September 18, 1959.

killers.Name: Martha Ann Johnson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of smothering three of her children in Atlanta between 1977 and 1982. Sentenced to life in prison on May 5, 1990.

killers.Name: Louise Peete
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of murdering a man and woman decades apart, four other acquaintances died suspiciously and four husbands committed suicide.

killers.Name: Stephen Morin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed three women and executed by Texas on March 13, 1985. Was also suspected in over 30 unsolved crimes.

killers.Name: Westley Allan Dodd
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Dodd had an extensive arrest record for molesting children by the time his behavior escalated to include murder. Refusing to appeal his death sentence, he stated that he "should be punished to the full extent of the law, as should all sex offenders and murderers", and that if he ever escaped, he would immediately return to "killing and raping kids". Executed in 1993; his hanging was the first in the United States in 28 years.

killers.Name: Scott Erskine
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of raping and murdering a woman in 1989 and the torture-murders of 2 boys in 1993. May be linked to other murders.

killers.Name: Donald Leroy Evans
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered a young girl and two women. Suspected of another dozen murders but recanted confessions to over 70 more. Stabbed to death by another death row inmate on January 5, 1999.

killers.Name: Richard Evonitz
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Abducted and killed 3 girls in Spotsylvania County, Virginia in 1996 and 1997

killers.Name: Akku Yadav
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered at least three people and dumped their bodies on the railroad tracks; lynched by a mob of around 200 women.[82]

killers.Name: Levi Bellfield
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Bus Stop Stalker"; convicted of the 2002 Murder of Amanda Dowler and two fatal hammer attacks on young women in South West London in 2003 and 2004. Sentenced to life

killers.Name: Daisy de Melker
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Poisoner; killed two husbands and one son from 1923–1932.

killers.Name: Robert Napper
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Rapist and murderer who mutilated one of his victims so badly that the policeman who found her was put into therapy for two years. Suspected of up to 70 violent sexual attacks in South East London attributed to the unidentified "Green Chain Rapist".

killers.Name: Charles Albright
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The trophies this seemingly well-adjusted former teacher took from his victims led the press to dub him the "Texas Eyeball Killer".

killers.Name: Bible John
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Unidentified strangler and rapist of young women active in Glasgow.

killers.Name: Leonarda Cianciulli
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed three women and turned them into soap and biscuits; known as "The Soapymaker of Correggio".

killers.Name: William Heirens
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Burglar who stabbed three females between. Known as "The Lipstick Killer".

killers.Name: Richard Laurence Marquette
killers.Miscellaneous.information: First 11th name on FBI 10 Most Wanted for killing, mutilating and dismembering a woman in 1961; killed two more with same MO upon 1973 release.

killers.Name: Lee Roy Martin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Gaffney Strangler"; killed two women and two girls in South Carolina in 1967 and 1968.

killers.Name: John Joubert
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Nebraska Boy Snatcher", Joubert was enlisted in US Air Force when he was arrested for the murders of two children. Later linked to another killing previous to his military service, of an 11-year-old boy in Maine. Joubert's criminal behavior began at the age of 13, with a series of random attacks on strangers that went unsolved until his arrest in Nebraska.

killers.Name: Altemio Sanchez
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Bike Path Rapist" for murdering three women and raping at least 14 others in and around the Buffalo, New York area. Sentenced to 75 years in prison without the possibility of parole.

killers.Name: Charles Schmid
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Pied Piper of Tucson"; murdered three teenage girls in 1964 and 1965 and buried them in the desert.

killers.Name: Karl F. Warner
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of murdering three teenage girls, in two separate incidents, in the San Francisco Bay Area communities of San Jose and Saratoga, he was briefly suspected of being the notorious Zodiac Killer, but was soon ruled out as a suspect in that case.

killers.Name: Howard Arthur Allen
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed three elderly people, as well as assault, burglary, and arson. Sentenced to death June 11, 1988.

killers.Name: Steven David Catlin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Poisoned three people from 1976 to 1984. Sentenced to death in 1990.

killers.Name: Paul Michael Stephani
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Weepy-Voiced Killer"; would call police and ask for help after murders. Killed 3 women in the cities of Saint Paul and Minneapolis, Minnesota.

killers.Name: Brian Dugan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of murdering 2 girls and a woman between 1983 and 1985.[83]

killers.Name: Heriberto Seda
killers.Miscellaneous.information: New York City copycat killer of the Zodiac Killer active from 1990 to 1993; convicted of shooting eight individuals, killing three; sentenced to life imprisonment in 1998.

killers.Name: Harvey Miguel Robinson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Teenager who stalked, raped and killed three women in Allentown, Pennsylvania in 1992 and 1993.

killers.Name: Dana Sue Gray
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of murder of three elderly women and attempted murder of a fourth in California.[84]

killers.Name: Jack Owen Spillman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Werewolf Butcher"; killed two girls and the mother of one of them in Washington State in 1994 and 1995.

killers.Name: Scott Williams
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed and mutilated three women between 1997 and 2006. Sentenced to life.

killers.Name: Juan Covington
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Shot and killed 3 people.[85]

killers.Name: Michael Madison
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Suspected American serial killer from East Cleveland, Ohio who is currently being held in custody as a suspect in at least three murders.

killers.Name: Gabriel Garza Hoth
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Black Widower", killed 3 women between 1991 and 1998, his victims were wives and lovers.

killers.Name: Mario Alberto Sulú Canché
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed 3 women from 2007 to 2008; later committing suicide by hanging in prison.

killers.Name: Martha Rendell
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed three stepchildren with hydrochloric acid in the 20th century; last woman to be hanged in Western Australia.

killers.Name: Eddie Leonski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to three murders after being picked out of a line of American servicemen by witnesses. Sentenced to death and hanged.

killers.Name: Gregory Brazel
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Shot dead a woman in 1982 armed robbery and murdered two prostitutes in 1990.

killers.Name: Claremont killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murders of two young women and the disappearance of a third in 1996 and 1997.

killers.Name: Matthew James Harris
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Strangled a friend's brother, a female friend and a male neighbour to death over five weeks in 1998 in Wagga Wagga.

killers.Name: Francisca Ballesteros
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Black Widow of Valencia". Poisoned her husband and three children, one of whom survived. Sentenced to 85 years in prison in 2005.

killers.Name: Dámaso Rodríguez Martín
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Serial rapist and voyeur known as "The Warlock". After being sentenced to 55 years for murdering a man and raping his girlfriend in 1981, he escaped from prison in 1991 and fled to the Anaga mountains in Tenerife, where he killed a couple of German hikers (the woman was also raped). Cornered in an abandoned house, Martín shot himself unsuccessfully and was then shot dead by law enforcement.

killers.Name: Gustavo Romero Tercero
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Valdepeñas Killer". Armed robber and rapist, he killed a couple after the woman recognized him in 1993, and another woman in 1998 after accidentally hitting her with his car, fearing that a possible investigation would link him to the other crimes. Confessed and was sentenced to 83 years in prison for all crimes in 2003, after his ex-wife denounced him.

killers.Name: Lam Kwok-wai
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of 10 rapes and 3 murders that he committed with his bare hands. One of two only known serial killers in Hong Kong.

killers.Name: George Chapman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Poisoned three consecutive mistresses with tartar emetic. Considered the possible identity of Jack the Ripper at the time of his execution (1903).

killers.Name: George Joseph Smith
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Brides in the Bath Murders"; killer of three women. Executed by hanging on August 13, 1915.

killers.Name: Peter Bryan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A paranoid schizophrenic, Bryan was recluded in a mental institution after killing a shop assistant with a hammer in 1993. Released 11 years later after psychiatrists noted his "continued improvement", Bryan immediately killed a friend and was apprehended when he was frying his brains on a pan. Months later, Bryan killed a fellow mental patient, declaring that he didn't eat him solely because he was caught first. Currently imprisoned for life.

killers.Name: Anthony Hardy
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed and dismembered three prostitutes. Diagnosed with personality disorder and recluded in a mental institution for life.

killers.Name: Trevor Hardy
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called "The Monster of Manchester". Died in prison in 2012.

killers.Name: Robin Ligus
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Died in a mental institution in 2012.

killers.Name: John Straffen
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed his third victim after escaping from the mental hospital where he was recluded for the first two murders. Longest-held prisoner in modern British history at the time of his death in 2007.

killers.Name: Graham Young
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called the "Teacup Poisoner". Poisoned over 70 people, 3 of whom died.

killers.Name: Valery Asratyan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped dozens of women in Moscow, murdering three. Executed.

killers.Name: Silvo Plut
killers.Miscellaneous.information: After serving 13 years in prison in Slovenia for a rape and murder, Plut murdered a second woman in Serbia in 2004 and fled back to Slovenia, where a Serbian petition of extradition was turned down by the government. Plut was then arrested for attacking a couple (wife died, husband survived) and sentenced to 30 years in prison. Committed suicide in 2007.

killers.Name: António Luís Costa
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Ex-soldier, suffocated three women (and mutilated the first one) in Santa Comba Dao.

killers.Name: Yukio Yamaji
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murdered his own mother in 2000, and then murdered a 27-year-old woman and her 19-year-old sister in 2005.[86]

killers.Name: Hiroshi Maeue
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called the "Suicide Website Murderer" for finding his victims in an online suicide community. Maeue offered to painlessly kill themselves together by charcoal burning in a car, but once together he strangled them with his bare hands instead, as this excited him sexually. Hanged in 2009.

killers.Name: Antonis Daglis
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Athens Ripper". A serial rapist with antecedents for violence, Daglis upgraded to raping, strangling and dismembering three prostitutes with a hacksaw in 1992, and tried to kill six more women. In his trial he claimed to hate all prostitutes. Killed himself in prison in 1997.

killers.Name: Joanna Dennehy
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Carried out the Peterborough ditch murders. Over a period of two weeks, murdered her landlord and two of her house mates by stabbing them. With the help of accomplices she dumped the bodies in ditches, then attempted to kill two strangers in broad daylight by stabbing them. Given whole life tariff on 28 February 2014.

killers.Name: Özgür Dengiz
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Cannibal of Ankara" for eating one of his victims; a third victim survived. Interned in a mental institution after his conviction to two life sentences was overturned.

killers.Name: Erwin Hagedorn
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed three boys ages 9 to 12. Was convicted and executed in 1972.

killers.Name: Alejandro Máynez
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed at least two women in Ciudad Juárez, but believed to be 50. Supposedly, along with Ana Benavides and Melchor Máynez.

killers.Name: Billy Gohl
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Alleged to have killed from 40 to 140 seamen in Aberdeen, Washington

killers.Name: Gerard John Schaefer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Florida police officer who killed up to 34 women and girls. Stabbed to death by fellow inmate Vincent Faustino Rivera on December 3, 1995.

killers.Name: Raman Raghav
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Psychopathic serial killer who killed slum dwellers by bludgeoning them when they were asleep. Was charged with 2 murders and sentenced to death, which was later reduced to life in prison.

killers.Name: Francisco Guerrero
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called El Chalequero ("The Vests Man"). Believed to have raped and murdered 20 women between 1880 and 1888 that were found in the Consulado River after having been beaten, strangled, gutted or decapitated, but convicted of only one and another attempt to 20 years in prison in 1888. Indulted in 1904, he was arrested for raping and killing another woman in 1908 and sentenced to death, but died of natural causes in prison before he could be executed, in 1910.

killers.Name: Darbara Singh
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted for two murders. Suspected of killing 15 girls and two boys from April to October 2004.

killers.Name: Macario Alcala Canchola
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "Mexican Jack"; convicted of the murders of two prostitutes but suspected of at least twelve more murders.

killers.Name: Ed Gein
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Famous for his necrophiliac behaviours, as well as using/storing body parts of his victims to make household furniture, clothing and other miscellaneous household items.

killers.Name: José Luis Calva
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed and cannibalized women. Hanged himself in prison after being convicted to 84 years for two murders.

killers.Name: Robert Zarinsky
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed people between 1958 and 1974.

killers.Name: Shirley Winters
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed in 2008 to killing 2 children (including her 5-month old son), 27 years apart. Plea agreement for those murders included clause stopping investigation of her role in a fire that killed 2 previous children in 1979. Is also a suspect in a separate fire that killed 3 children of a friend in 1979.

killers.Name: Glen Rogers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: His capture in Kentucky ended a nationwide manhunt that began with the "Cross-Country Killer's" crime spree that stretched from coast to coast and left four women and one man from five different states dead. Rogers was convicted and sentenced to death by electric chair in Florida in 1997 for the stabbing death of Tina Marie Cribbs. He was later convicted and given a second death penalty in California for the September 1995 murder of Sandra Gallagher. Also known as the "Casanova Killer", Rogers is the lone suspect in the stabbing deaths of two other women (Linda Price in Jackson, Mississippi and Andy Jiles Sutton in Bossier City, Louisiana), both of whom—like Cribbs and Gallagher—he'd met and befriended in bars. The earliest homicide Rogers is suspected of is that of an elderly Ohio man, Mark Peters, with whom Rogers had lived for a short time. In 1994, Peters' remains were discovered in a Rogers "family cabin" in Kentucky.[88]

killers.Name: Steven Brian Pennell
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Corridor Killer" and "The Route 40 Killer"; convicted of torture-murdering two women, pleaded no contest to two more and suspected of a fifth in Delaware in 1987 and 1988. Executed by lethal injection March 14, 1992.

killers.Name: Mary Elizabeth Wilson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Merry Widow of Windy Nook". Believed to have poisoned her four husbands in a period of only two years. Sentenced to death for two murders but changed to life in prison, where she died in 1963.

killers.Name: Hadden Clark
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed and cannibalized a 6-year-old victim and a 23-year-old victim, and confessed to the murder of an unidentified woman nicknamed Lady of the Dunes.

killers.Name: Gary M. Heidnik
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Kidnapped, tortured, raped and imprisoned six women in his Philadelphia, Pennsylvania basement, killing two.

killers.Name: Ronny Rieken
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped and killed two girls ages 11 and 13. He was caught as a result of mass DNA screening and sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Johann Otto Hoch
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Swindler who married several women under different aliases, most of whom died after a few months; others disappeared without a trace. Convicted of one murder by poisoning and hanged.

killers.Name: Carl Großmann
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Berlin Butcher". Killed women and sold their flesh on the black market. Only one body found. Hanged himself in his cell after being sentenced to death.[89]

killers.Name: Sailson Jose das Gracas
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Claims to have murdered 41 people in a nine-year killing spree that started at the age of 17.[90]

killers.Name: Bobby Jack Fowler
killers.Miscellaneous.information: One murder proven, suspected of up to 20 more. Suspect in the Highway of Tears murders.[91]

killers.Name: Leszek Pękalski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Called "The Vampire of Bytów". Charged with 17 murders but convicted of only one (to 25 years in prison) for faulty collection of evidence. During the investigation he admitted to killing 80 people but later retracted his confession.

killers.Name: Daniel Conahan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of one murder and has been linked to over a dozen murders.

killers.Name: Tillie Klimek
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Chicago woman who poisoned her husbands; only convicted of the murder of her third husband. Sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Lyda Southard
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Suspected of killing her brother-in-law, four husbands and a daughter, but was only convicted of killing her fourth husband, Edward Meyer.

killers.Name: John Norman Collins
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of the murder of Karen Sue Beineman, suspected in the murder of at least five other young women in the vicinity of Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti, Michigan.

killers.Name: Velma Barfield
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to five poisonings with arsenic but was only tried and convicted for one. First woman to be executed in the United States after the 1976 resumption of capital punishment, receiving lethal injection in 1984.

killers.Name: Raymond Morris
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "A34 Killer"; convicted of one murder, considered to have committed at least two more.

killers.Name: Robert Anthony Buell
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Sentenced to death for the murder of a young girl and chief suspect in the murders of two others. Executed by lethal injection in 2002.

killers.Name: Harold Shipman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of 15 murders and responsible for the deaths of 218 patients identified by inquiry but is believed to have killed up to 250 people.[93] He injected diamorphine into his patients and then falsified the medical records, reporting that his patient had been in poor health. Known (after his arrest only) as Doctor Death.[94] Hanged himself in prison.

killers.Name: Hu Wanlin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Ran hospitals in Shanxi, Shaanxi, and Henan despite lacking a license or any kind of medical formation, where he administered poisonous "miracle cures" that contained high amounts of sodium sulphate.

killers.Name: Miyuki Ishikawa
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed more than 103 newborn children. As a maternity nurse she killed infants born to parents unwilling to care for them during the prohibition of abortion in Japan. Arrested in 1948 and sentenced to 4 years in prison.

killers.Name: Steven Massof
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Massof, who worked at Kermit Gosnell's abortion clinic, testified that he snipped the spines of more than 100 babies after seeing them show signs of life.[95][96]

killers.Name: Louay Omar Mohammed al-Taei
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Medical doctor found to have killed 43 wounded policemen, soldiers and officials in Kirkuk; was a member of an insurgent cell.

killers.Name: Daniela Poggiali
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who killed 38 of her patients.

killers.Name: Donald Harvey
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Self-professed Angel of Death. Worked as an orderly in Cincinnati-area hospitals and preyed on his patients. Claims to have killed 87 patients starting at age 18. Active 1970–1987. Serving 28 life sentences in Ohio.[97]

killers.Name: Jane Toppan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse that confessed to poisoning 31 patients for her own sexual gratification. After overdosing them she would get in bed and lie with them as they died. Found not guilty by reason of insanity and interned in a mental institution until her death in 1938.

killers.Name: Stephan Letter
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who killed 29 patients; Sentenced to life on November 20, 2006.

killers.Name: Anders Hansson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A Nurse Aide who poisoned victims with gevisol and ivisol. His actions were called "The Hospital Murders" (Swedish: Sjukhusmorden).[98]

killers.Name: Marcel Petiot
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Active 1926 and from 1942 to 1944. Petiot is suspected of having killed up to 63 in total. Executed in 1946.[99]

killers.Name: Arnfinn Nesset
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Norwegian nurse and most prolific known serial killer in Scandinavian history, convicted on 18 March 1983 of poisoning at least 22 patients with Curacit; however he initially confessed to 27 murders; after he retracted his confessions and he told he had killed 138 patients. Was released from prison in 2004 after serving 21 years, the maximum punishment possible by Norwegian law.[100]

killers.Name: Charles Cullen
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse in New Jersey and Pennsylvania who murdered at least 29 patients between 1988 and 2003, but experts believe the number could be as high as 400. Cullen has admitted to more murders, which authorities believe are likely, but the murders cannot be verified due to lack of records.[101]

killers.Name: Maxim Petrov
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Doctor who killed his patients in St. Petersburg. Suspected of 19 murders.[102]

killers.Name: Joan Vila
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nursing home worker who fatally poisoned 11 elderly residents or more in Olot. In the trial he claimed they were mercy kills intended to spare the victims of further suffering, although three of them were administered caustic cleaning materials that caused severe burns and a long agony.[104]

killers.Name: Ann Arbor Hospital Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Poisonings of ten patients at the Veteran's Administration Hospital in 1975. Filipino nurses Filipina Narciso and Leonora Perez were tried for the crimes.

killers.Name: Frederick Mors
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Born Carl Menarik, Austrian who killed 8 elderly patients by poisoning in New York. Sent to an asylum and escaped. Never caught.

killers.Name: Marianne Nölle
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who was convicted of killing seven patients between 1984 and 1992; suspected of killing 17; sentenced to life imprisonment in 1993.[105]

killers.Name: Petr Zelenka
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed his victims with a lethal injection of heparin from May to September 2006. Ten people survived his murder attempt. Suspected of up to 14 additional murders.

killers.Name: Orville Lynn Majors
killers.Miscellaneous.information: LPN in Vermillion County Ind., Preyed on elderly patients—thought to have killed many of them with injections of potassium chloride. Serving 360 years in Indiana.

killers.Name: Efren Saldivar
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Respiratory therapist who killed six patients, possibly as many as 120.[107]

killers.Name: Christine Malèvre
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who killed terminally ill patients claiming that they had asked her to help them die, something denied by their families. Sentenced to 12 years in prison for 6 murders and suspect of 30.

killers.Name: Kristen Gilbert
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse at a Massachusetts Veterans Medical Center who injected male patients with epinephrine, causing heart attacks. Sentenced to life without parole.

killers.Name: Amy Archer-Gilligan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A nursing home proprietor believed to have poisoned as many as 60 patients from her homes and her second husband. Charged with 5 murders originally, this was lowered to just one following her admission of guilt, and was found guilty of second degree murder. Died in a mental hospital in 1962.

killers.Name: Aino Nykopp-Koski
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who killed five elderly patients using sedatives and opiates in Finland.

killers.Name: Kimberly Clark Saenz
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed five patients by using syringes to inject bleach into their dialysis lines.

killers.Name: Michael Swango
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Murderer and serial killer suspect.

killers.Name: Kermit Gosnell
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Gosnell, who ran an abortion clinic, was charged with 8 and convicted of 4 murders. Three babies were born alive, then killed by cutting the infant's spine with scissors. One mother died due to complications. Testimony indicated hundreds of similar procedures carried out by Gosnell and his staff.

killers.Name: Edson Izidoro Guimaraes
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who injected patients with potassium chloride or took their oxygen masks off. Confessed to 5 murders which he claimed to be mercy kills and was convicted of 4 in 2000, sentenced to 76 years in prison. Some believe that he might have killed as many as 131 patients for money, as he was paid $60 for informing local funeral homes of a patient's death so that they could contact the deceased's relatives first.

killers.Name: Richard Angelo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Angel of Death". New York nurse convicted of four murders, linked to 6 other deaths. Suspected of killing up to 25 people.

killers.Name: Beverley Allitt
killers.Miscellaneous.information: A nurse, Allitt attacked 11 children in her care during a period of 59 days, killing four of them. Some of the victims were overdosed with insulin, others were injected with air bubbles. Imprisoned for life since 1993.

killers.Name: Abraao Jose Bueno
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who injected young children with sedatives until they stopped breathing. He would then alert doctors in an attempt to earn the respect of his colleagues for being the first one to notice that something was wrong. Convicted of 4 deaths and 4 more murder attempts to 110 years in prison.

killers.Name: Marie Fikáčková
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse who was executed by hanging in 1961 for murdering babies.

killers.Name: Felícitas Sánchez Aguillón
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Ogress of Roma neighborhood"; Nurse, midwife and baby farmer responsible for an unknown number of murders number during the 1930s, maybe 50 victims, in Mexico City.

killers.Name: Genene Jones
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Pediatric nurse who poisoned infants in her care; convicted of only one murder but suspected many more.[108]

killers.Name: Linda Hazzard
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Self-declared doctor and fasting specialist, which she advertised as a panacea for every medical ailment. Up to 40 patients could have died of starvation in her "sanitarium" of Olalla, Washington. Imprisoned for one death in 1912, was paroled in 1915 and continued to practice medicine without a license in New Zealand (1915–1920) and Washington (1920–1935). Died in 1938 while attempting a fasting to cure herself.

killers.Name: Robert George Clements
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Believed to have murdered his four wives, all of whom died young and had their death certificates signed by Clements himself. Clements committed suicide with a morphine overdose when police came to arrest him for the murder of his fourth wife, who had died of the same cause.

killers.Name: Philadelphia poison ring
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Gang of 16 that poisoned Italian immigrants with arsenic in order to collect their life insurance. The leaders, cousins Herman and Paul Petrillo, were executed on the electric chair in 1941 while the rest were given life sentences.

killers.Name: Delfina and María de Jesús González
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Two sisters who ran a brothel in Mexico, hired numerous prostitutes and murdered at least 80 of them after they were deemed useless during the span of ten years. They also killed 11 men. Probably the work of four of the sisters, sentenced to 40 years in prison. Body count varies due to the combined work of the sisters being impossible to assign to them individually.[9]

killers.Name: Angel Makers of Nagyrév
killers.Miscellaneous.information: 26 women who poisoned their husbands (sometimes also their parents, lovers and children) with arsenic under the guidance of midwife Júlia Fazekas and her accomplice, Susi Oláh.

killers.Name: Dean Corll, David Owen Brooks and Elmer Wayne Henley
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Corll, known as "The Candy Man", killed at least 28 teenage boys and young men in Houston between 1970 and 1973. Corll was then shot and killed by one of the two teenage accomplices he recruited to assist him in the abductions of the victims on August 8, 1973. This accomplice, Elmer Wayne Henley, informed the police of the trio's murders the same day Corll was murdered.[21]

killers.Name: Adolfo Constanzo and Sara Aldrete
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Godparents of Matamoros". Leader and second in command of a cult that abducted men to perform human sacrifices.

killers.Name: Igor Suprunyuck and Viktor Sayenko
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Also known as "The Dnepropetrovsk Maniacs". Killed random people over a two-month period and tortured dogs and cats, received lifetime imprisonment.

killers.Name: Surinder Koli and Moninder Singh Pandher[disputed – discuss]
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Between 2005 and 2006, businessman Moninder Singh Pandher and his domestic servant, Surender Koli, kidnapped, raped, murdered, and dismembered 19 people (mostly children). Convicted.

killers.Name: Anísio Ferreira de Sousa and followers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Satanic ring that abducted, mutilated and sacrificed children in Altamira, Brazil. The leader, Ferreira de Sousa, was convicted for four murders and two more attempts to 77 years in prison.

killers.Name: Ripper Crew
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Abducted women, mostly prostitutes, then raped, tortured and killed them in Chicago, Illinois.

killers.Name: John Allen Muhammad and Lee Boyd Malvo
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed seven people from February to September 2002 and ten in the Beltway sniper attacks of October 2002.

killers.Name: Vladyslav Volkovich and Volodymyr Kondratenko
killers.Miscellaneous.information: "The Nighttime Killers". Murdered homeless men and lone drivers with a variety of weapons.

killers.Name: Death Angels
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Four black supremacists that killed 16 white people and injured between 8 and 10 in San Francisco (Zebra murders).

killers.Name: Lainz Angels of Death
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Lainz Angels of Death"; Waltraud Wagner, Irene Leidolf, Stephanija Mayer, and Maria Gruber were nurses at the Lainz General Hospital in Vienna who admitted to murdering 49 patients.[109]

killers.Name: José Miculax Bux and Mariano Macú Miculax
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Cousins who killed 15 boys in 1946.

killers.Name: Fred West and Rosemary West
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Mainly targeted young females but were also found guilty of the murder of their own daughter. Also found guilty of raping another daughter. Buried the victims around their house and local area. Shortly before he committed suicide on New Year's Day, 1995, Fred West said there were more victims.[110]

killers.Name: Briley Brothers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Three brothers and an accomplice responsible for 12 murders in the 1970s in Richmond, Virginia.

killers.Name: Mailoni Brothers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Three brothers who killed at least 12 people from 2007 to 2013. Killed by Zambia Army Commandos in 2013.

killers.Name: Leonard Lake and Charles Ng
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Abducted women, used them as sex slaves, and then murdered them, together with any men, women, and children who got in their way. Lake committed suicide upon arrest, but Ng was later convicted of killing 11 people. Between 1982 and 1985, Lake and Ng were believed to have abducted and killed as many as 25 victims, as evidenced by human remains found on Lake's California ranch.[111]

killers.Name: Shen Changyin and Shen Changping
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Found guilty of the murders of 11 prostitutes.

killers.Name: Wolfgang Abel and Marco Furlan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The victims, seemingly chosen at random and killed by different methods, were found next to letters written in Italian, signed "Ludwig" and containing Nazi imagery, that gave a reason for why the murder had been committed. Abel and Furlan were arrested in Castiglione delle Stiviere while dousing a crowded discothèque with gasoline and sentenced in 1987 to 30 years in prison for all crimes (later reduced to 27).

killers.Name: Joshi-Abhyankar serial murderers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Four Pune commercial art students (Rajendra Jakkal, Dilip Sutar, Shantaram Kanhoji Jagtap and Munawar Harun Shah) that broke into random people's homes and businesses and strangled them with a nylon rope. Hanged in 1983.

killers.Name: Gerald and Charlene Gallego
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed ten victims in Sacramento, California. Gerald Gallego died of cancer before his death sentence could be carried out. Charlene Gallego was released July 1997.

killers.Name: Viña del Mar psychopaths
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Jorge Sagredo and Carlos Topp committed ten murders and four rapes from 5 August 1980 to November 1, 1981 in the city of Viña del Mar. Executed by firing squad on January 29, 1985, they became the last people executed in Chile.

killers.Name: National Socialist Underground
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Neo-Nazi group who killed ten ethnic Turks in the Bosphorus serial murders from 2000 to 2007. Most victims were small business owners killed in broad daylight with a gunshot to the face. Two of the suspects committed suicide and a third, Beate Zschäpe, was apprehended in November 2011.

killers.Name: The Hernández Brothers Sect
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Originally a scam intended to extort money and sexual favors from the poor, illiterate inhabitants of the small village of Yerba Buena, who were promised favors from "Inca gods" in the mountains, the cult came to include Aztec-inspired human sacrifices after prostitute Magdalena Solís took over as high priestess. 15 people were sentenced to 30 years in prison for their participation in the ritual murders of seven villagers and one police officer.

killers.Name: Rudolfo Infante and Anna Villeda
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Responsible for 8 murders.[112]

killers.Name: Dale Hausner and Samuel Dieteman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Serial Shooter". Responsible for 8 murders in random drive-by shootings in 2006 in Phoenix, Arizona.

killers.Name: Futoshi Matsunaga and Junko Ogata
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Under Matsunaga's leadership, who had a long history of conning (and possibly murdering) women, the couple abducted, tortured and disposed of the bodies of six relatives of Ogata and one neighbor in their condominium of Kitakyushu. Matsunaga was sentenced to death and Ogata to life in prison in 2007.

killers.Name: Christopher Worrell and James Miller
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Truro Murderers"; convicted of killing seven victims in South Australia.

killers.Name: Auto Shankar's Gang
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nine men who collaborated to abduct and murder at least 6 teenage girls in Chennai; their bodies were cremated and thrown into the sea or buried under residential homes. Leader Auto Shankar and two accomplices were sentenced to death by hanging in 1991, his brother Auto Mohan to three consecutive life sentences in prison and five other collaborators to six months in prison.

killers.Name: Gert van Rooyen and Joey Haarhof
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Their victims were never found; the pair shot dead a police officer and then committed suicide when faced with arrest after the escape of their last kidnap victim.

killers.Name: Hermann Duft and Hans Wilhelm Bassenauer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: German serial killers who murdered six persons in Greece, within a short period in 1969, were captured, tried, sentenced to death and executed.

killers.Name: David Alan Gore and Fred Waterfield
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Cousins connected to the murders of six females. Gore was executed in 2012 and Waterfield was sentenced to life imprisonment.

killers.Name: Artyom Alexandrovich Anoufriev and Nikita Vakhtangovich Lytkin
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Teenaged thrill-killers of random people.

killers.Name: Ray and Faye Copeland
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Oldest couple ever sentenced to death in the United States at the ages of 75 and 69; convicted of killing 5 men; modus operandi was to hire unskilled drifters as farm hands and later kill them.[113]

killers.Name: Ian Brady and Myra Hindley
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The "Moors Murderers". Abducted children in northern England. They were found guilty of two and three murders respectively.

killers.Name: The Skin Hunters
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Hospital crew that killed patients in order to get bribes from nearby funeral homes. Two doctors and two paramedics were convicted for the murder of five patients, but the investigation is still going on with over 40 remaining suspects.

killers.Name: Gwendolyn Graham and Catherine May Wood
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurses who killed five elderly women in Grand Rapids, Michigan.

killers.Name: Lawrence Bittaker and Roy Norris
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as "The Tool Box Killers". Kidnapped, tortured, raped and murdered five girls in 1979.

killers.Name: James Gregory Marlow and Cynthia Coffman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Killed four women and one man in 1986.

killers.Name: Chijon family
killers.Miscellaneous.information: South Korean gang of cannibals that was sentenced to death for killing five people.

killers.Name: Loren Herzog and Wesley Shermantine
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Speed Freak Killers"; California duo initially convicted of 4 murders from 1984 to 1999.

killers.Name: David and Catherine Birnie
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Australian couple who raped and murdered four women in their home and attempted to murder a fifth in Perth in 1986. Both were sentenced to four consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole; David Birnie hanged himself in prison on October 7, 2005.

killers.Name: Raymond Fernandez and Martha Beck
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Known as the "Lonely Hearts Killers", Fernandez and Beck extorted women Fernandez met through lonely hearts advertisements. Both were arrested in Michigan in 1949 for the murders of a woman and her 2-year-old daughter, but Michigan authorities waived prosecution and extradited the pair to New York to face trial for a murder that occurred there because New York had the death penalty while Michigan did not. They were convicted of that murder and executed on March 8, 1951.

killers.Name: Michael Bear Carson and Suzan Carson
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nomadic hippie killers involved in the counter-culture movement; sentenced to life imprisonment for three San Francisco Bay Area murders in 1983.

killers.Name: Joseph and Michael Kallinger
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Joseph Kallinger murdered three people and tortured four families with his 13-year-old son Michael in New Jersey.

killers.Name: John Duffy and David Mulcahy
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Raped dozens of women in train stations (beginning in 1982) before switching to murder.

killers.Name: Beasts of Satan
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The members of this group committed three notorious ritual murders over six years.

killers.Name: Silvia Merez Cult
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Ritually murdered three people in sacrifices to Santa Muerte.

killers.Name: Raya and Sakina and their husbands
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Gang of four that rented a house for women and killed them to rob their money and jewellery. Raya and Sakina were the first women executed in the modern state of Egypt, in 1921.

killers.Name: Javed Iqbal
killers.Miscellaneous.information: He raped, strangled and put acid in several children. Arrested, he claimed 100 victims. He was found guilty of 100 killings but 26 children were found alive after he hanged himself in prison.[115]

killers.Name: Bruno Lüdke
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Mentally disabled, Lüdke was arrested after being discovered with a corpse. Police declared him insane and imprisoned him in a psychiatric hospital, where he was experimented on before being executed in 1944. The case remains controversial, as the only evidence tying him to the crimes was a confession that may have been physically coerced.

killers.Name: Fernando Hernández Leyva
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to 100 murders and six kidnappings at the time of his arrest in 1999 (he had been arrested previously in 1982 and 1986, the second time for murder, but escaped from prison), but later retracted and claimed that he had been beaten by the police and his family threatened in order to force him to confess. Accused of as many as 137 murders in five southern Mexican states, convicted of 33 to 50 years in prison. Tried to kill himself in prison unsuccessfully.[116]

killers.Name: Vera Renczi
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Convicted of killing 35 men through arsenic poisoning but confessed to only killing 32 victims.[117]

killers.Name: Gerald Stano
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to killing 41 women in mostly Florida and New Jersey areas. Some controversy surrounds the case as he is believed by some to have been a serial confessor.

killers.Name: "Highway of Tears" Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: All the victims were young women and were last seen on Highway 16 in British Columbia between Prince George and Prince Rupert. If they were all victims of the same person, it would be one of the most proficient serial killers in Canada and one with the longest careers in the world. Some of the murders have been linked to American criminal Bobby Jack Fowler, although he was in prison at the time others were committed.

killers.Name: The Stoneman
killers.Miscellaneous.information: 12 homeless people were murdered in their sleep in Bombay between 1985 and 1987, and 13 in Calcutta in 1989; in all cases, by dropping a large rock over their head (an additional victim escaped, but could not identify the attacker). It is ignored if all were committed by the same person(s) or some were copycat crimes, and no one was ever charged with any of the murders.

killers.Name: David Parker Ray
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Torture-murderer possibly aided by numerous accomplices, including his girlfriend. Targeted victims in the Truth or Consequences, New Mexico, area, convicted of killing 14 victims and suspected of 60 murders, even though no body was ever found. Known as the "Toybox Killer" for the self-built mobile home he used as a house to rape, torture, and kill women.

killers.Name: Henry Lee Lucas
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed to killing at least 600 people but later recanted and is suspected of lying about a majority of his murders. He originally offered a list of 77 women from 19 different states, as he confessed to more and more murders, the details became increasingly more bizarre. Some included dismemberment, necrophilia, even cannibalism. Lawmen linked the Lucas and Otis Toole to 81 murders alone. Convicted of 11 murders.[118] Detectives from 40 states came to visit Lucas, and an estimated 3,000 homicides were discussed in what is considered to be one of the greatest mockeries of the U.S. legal system when police officers cleared their books of unsolved murders.[119] The true number of murders committed by Lucas is unknown, but it is likely Lucas was not nearly as prolific a serial killer as he initially claimed to be, as most of his murder confessions were thoroughly discredited, and he himself claimed only one murder—that of his mother.[119][120][121] Probably responsible for the deaths of 40 people.[122]

killers.Name: Charles Quansah
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Quansah, who had been in prison for rape twice, was held as a suspect in the deaths of 34 women across the country, including his girlfriend who was strangled in 2000, and eventually confessed to eight murders. He later denied the killings, claiming that the confessions had been extracted under torture, and that the police had also tried unsuccessfully to force him to implicate a number of politicians including former president Jerry Rawlings, his wife Nana Konadu Agyeman and an unidentified member of president John Kufuor's administration.[123][124]

killers.Name: Redhead murders
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Series of unsolved homicides believed to have been committed by an unidentified serial killer in Tennessee, Arkansas, Kentucky, Mississippi and Pennsylvania.

killers.Name: Jeff Davis 8
killers.Miscellaneous.information: The bodies of eight women, all of whom had an involvement with drugs or prostitution, were found in swamps and canals surrounding Jennings, Louisiana. Originally thought to be a serial killer, but multiple suspects may be involved.

killers.Name: Ottis Toole
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Initially convicted of three counts of murder, later pleading guilty to four more murders before dying in prison. A sometime accomplice of convicted serial killer Henry Lee Lucas, Toole admitted to—and retracted multiple times—over a hundred counts of murder, rape, arson and cannibalism, and was the suspect in several other unsolved murders. On December 16, 2008, police announced that they had identified Toole as the likely murderer of Adam Walsh, and would be closing the case as a result.

killers.Name: The Beer Man
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Purported unidentified serial killer that operated in Mumbai and left a beer bottle next to each body as his signature, hence the nickname. A suspect was charged with three of the murders and convicted of one in 2008, but the sentence was overturned by the High Court in 2009 because the evidence presented was deemed inadmissible.

killers.Name: José Pedro Guedes
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Confessed and was arrested for the "Lisbon Ripper" murders in 2011, but could not be prosecuted because the Portuguese statute of limitations had already run out. Also suspected of similar murders in Lisbon and Aveiro, Portugal, as well as Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark, Czech Republic and the 1988 New Bedford Highway Killings in Massachusetts, USA.

killers.Name: "Bowraville Murders" Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Proposed serial killer responsible of the murders of three Aboriginal children in the same area, all bludgeoned to death. Thomas Jay Hart was tried for one of the murders and acquitted, and held as a suspect in another for which he did not face prosecution.

killers.Name: Joe Ball
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Bootlegger and barman known as the "Butcher of Elmendorf", the "Bluebeard of South Texas", and "the Alligator Man" because of the alligator pit he had in the back of his bar and where he entertained clients by throwing live animals to the reptiles. Ball killed for sure two barmaids whose bodies were dug and later discovered at the beach, but he shot himself fatally in the chest when police came to question him and was never arrested or interrogated. Yellow press and pulp magazines later exaggerated his exploits, claiming that he had killed up to 20 women and fed them to the alligators, but this was never proven and caused some of Ball's relatives to sue such publications. Police investigated about a dozen women that had worked at Ball's place and were missing at the time of his suicide; some were found alive in San Antonio, but others couldn't be accounted for.[125]

killers.Name: "Texas Killing Fields" Killers
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Since the early 1970s roughly 30 bodies have been extracted from the fields, mainly consisting of young girls. May have been the work of multiple killers. Convicted murderer Edward Harold Bell, 72 years old in November 2011, claimed in a letter to police in 1998 to have murdered 11 girls in Galveston County. Kevin Edison Smith was sentenced to life imprisonment for one of the murders in 2012.

killers.Name: Abdul Latif Sharif
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Egyptian chemist known as "The Jackal of Ciudad Juárez". After migrating to the United States in the 1970s, Sharif served 14 years in prison for several rapes but fled to Mexico when he was about to be deported to his home country. There, he was accused of up to 20 of the female homicides in Ciudad Juárez but was convicted of only one, to 30 years in prison, where he died of natural causes in 2006. As the high rate of female murders has continued to this day in Ciudad Juárez, it has been claimed that Sharif was used as a scapegoat by the Mexican police.

killers.Name: Daisuke Mori
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Nurse that was sentenced to life imprisonment for one murder but suspected of killing at least ten others. He might have confessed to some of the murders in order to protect others.

killers.Name: Lowell Amos
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Detroit businessman sentenced to life imprisonment in 1996 for the murder of his third wife. Suspected of, but never charged with the deaths of two previous wives and his mother, all of whom died under suspicious circumstances and left life insurance policies to Amos that, at least in one case, Amos himself had bought against the will of the insured.

killers.Name: Bevan Spencer von Einem
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Arrested for three and convicted of one of "The Family Murders", where four teenagers and one young adult, all male, were drugged, kidnapped, raped and mutilated for weeks before their bodies were abandoned in the country near Adelaide. Police believed that von Einem had several accomplices, none of whom were publicly identified or detained, and at the time of his trial it was widely reported that the murders had been committed by a group of 4 to 12 high-profile Australian men; von Einem himself claimed to be the victim of a conspiracy. He has also been considered a suspect in the disappearance of two girls near the Adelaide Oval in 1973 and the high-profile Beaumont children disappearance in 1966.

killers.Name: John Bodkin Adams
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Acquitted in a highly unusual trial in 1957 of murder but later found guilty of fraud. Archive evidence shows that he was almost certainly a killer but that his prosecution was botched for political reasons.

killers.Name: Smiley Face Killer
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Theoretical serial killer(s) thought by some sources to have drowned college-aged young men across the northern part of the country since 1997; most experts suggest that the deaths were accidental.

killers.Name: Marie Besnard
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Charged with the murders of 13 relatives with arsenic, all of whom had Besnard as their sole designated heir, but acquitted of all charges after three high profile trials that lasted a decade.

killers.Name: Dr. X killings
killers.Miscellaneous.information: Suspicious deaths of nine people at Riverdell Hospital in Oradell, New Jersey. Mario Enrique Jascalevich was acquitted in 1978.
